data.v: स वेगः कार्तवीर्येण संप्रेषिट इवाम्भसः । पुष्पोपहारं तत्सर्वं रावणस्य जहार ह ।।
data.md: That stream, as if driven against Rävaņa by Kārtavīryarjuna, carried away his collection of flowers.

data.v: रावणोऽर्धसमाप्तं तु उत्सृज्य नियमं तदा । नर्मदां पश्यते कान्तां प्रतिकूलां यथा प्रियाम् ।।
पश्चिमेन तु तं दृष्ट्वा सागरोद्गारसंनिभम् । वर्धन्तमम्भसो वेगं पूर्वामाशां प्रविश्य तु ।।
ततोऽनुद्भ्रान्तशकुनां स्वाभाव्ये परमे स्थिताम् । निर्विकाराङ्गनाभासां पश्यते रावणो नदीम् ।।
सव्येतरकराङ्गुल्या सशब्दं च दशाननः । वेगप्रभवमन्वेष्टुं सोऽदिशच्छुकसारणौ ।।
data.md: Thereupon being anxious to learn the cause of the rise of the river, the Ten-necked demon, with his right finger, hinted Suka and Sarana.

data.v: तौ तु रावणसंदिष्टौ भ्रातरौ शुकसारणौ । व्योमान्तरचरौ वीरौ प्रस्थितौ पश्चिमोन्मुखौ ।।
data.md: Being commanded by Rāvana, the two brothers, the heroic Suka and Sāraņa proceeded towards the west by the aerial way.

data.v: अर्धयोजनमात्रं तु गत्वा तौ तु निशाचरौ । पश्येतां पुरुषं तोये क्रीडन्तं सहयोषितम् ।।
data.md: And going half a league, the two night-rangers espied a man sporting in the waters with some females.

data.v: बृहत्सालप्रतीकशं तोयव्याकुलमूर्धजम् । मदरक्तान्तनयनं मदनाकारवर्चसं ।।
data.md: He was huge as a Sāla tree, his hairs were floating on the water, he was inebriate and his eyes were reddened in consequence thereof.

data.v: नदीं बाहुसहस्रेण रुन्धन्तमरिमर्दनम् । गिरिं पादसहस्रेण रुन्धन्तमिव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.md: Like to Sumeru holding the earth with his thousand feet he obstructed the current of the river with his thousand arms.

data.v: बालानां वरनारीणां सहस्रेणाभिसंवृतम् । समदानां करेणूनां सहस्रेणेव कुञ्जरम् ।।
data.md: He was surrounded by a thousands of beautiful damsels like an elephant by a thousands of she-elephants.

data.v: तमद्भुततमं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसौ शुकसारणौ । संनिवृत्तावुपागम्य रावणं तमथोचतुः ।।
data.md: Beholding that dreadful spectacle, the Rākṣasas-Śuka and Sāraṇa came back and approaching Rāvaņa communicated (all) to him.

data.v: बृहत्सालप्रतीकाशः कोऽप्यसौ राक्षसेश्वर । नर्मदां रोधवद्रुद्ध्वा क्रीडापयति योषितः ।।
data.md: O lord of Rākşasas, an unknown person, huge as a Sāla tree, is sporting with females obstructing the course of Narmadā like to a dam.

data.v: तेन बाहुसहस्रेण संनिरुद्धजला नदी । सागरोद्गारसंकाशानुद्गारान्सृजते मुहुः ।।
data.md: Being withheld by the thousand arms of that man the waters of Narmadā were continually throwing up high waves.

data.v: इत्येवं भाषमाणौ तौ निशम्य शुकसारणौ । रावणोऽर्जुन इत्युक्त्वा उत्तस्थौ युद्धलालसः ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of śuka and Sarana, Ravana exclaimed “This is Arjuna' and proceeded to fight with him.

data.v: अर्जुनाभिमुखे तस्मिन्प्रस्थिते राक्षसेश्वरे । सकृदेव कृतो रावः सरक्तः प्रेषितो घनैः ।।
महोदरमहापार्श्वधूम्राक्षशुकसारणैः । संवृतो राक्षसेन्द्रस्तु तत्रागाद्यत्र सोऽर्जुनः ।।
data.md: The clouds began to mutter with a downpour of rain. And the lord of Räkşasas proceeded against Arjuna with Mahodara. Mahāparáva, Dhumraksa, Suka and Sarana.

data.v: नातिदीर्घेण कालेन स ततो राक्षसो बली । तं नर्मदा ह्रदं भीममाजगामाञ्जनप्रभः ।।
स तत्र स्त्रीपरिवृतं वाशिताभिरिव द्विपम् । नरेन्द्रं पश्यते राजा राक्षसानां तदार्जुनम् ।।
data.md: Within a short time the dreadful Raksasa, powerful as the elephant Arjuna, reached the banks of Narmada and espied there Arjuna encircled by females as an elephant surrounded by she-elephants.

data.v: स रोषाद्रक्तनयनो राक्षसेन्द्रो बलोद्धतः । इत्येवमर्जुनामात्यानाह गम्भीरया गिरा ।।
data.md: At the very sight the eyes of the lord of Raksasas, proud of his prowess, grew red and addressing the councillors of the king Arjuna he said.

data.v: अमात्याः क्षिप्रमाख्यात हैहयस्य नृपस्य वै । युद्धार्थं समनुप्राप्तो रावणो नाम नामतः ।।
data.md: Do you communicate to the king of Haihayas that Rāvana, the lord of Raksasas, has come to fight with him.

data.v: रावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा मन्त्रिणोऽथार्जुनस्य ते । उत्तस्थुः सायुधास्तं च रावणं वाक्यमब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of Rāvana, the ministers of Arjuna stood up with arms and said.

data.v: युद्धस्य कालो विज्ञातः साधु भोः साधु रावण । यः क्षीबं स्त्रीवृतं चैव योद्धुमिच्छसि नो नृपम् । वाशितामध्यगं मत्तं शार्दूल इव कुञ्जरम् ।।
क्षमस्वाद्य दशग्रीव उष्यतां रजनी त्वया । युद्धश्रद्धा तु यद्यस्ति श्वस्तात समरेऽर्जुनम् ।।
यदि वापि त्वरा तुभ्यं युद्धतृष्णासमावृता । निहत्यास्मांस्ततो युद्धमर्जुनेनोपयास्यसि ।।
ततस्ते रावणामात्यैरमात्याः पार्थिवस्य तु । सूदिताश्चापि ते युद्धे भक्षिताश्च बुभुक्षितैः ।।
data.md: Thereupon the hungry councillors of Rāvana, slew some of the ministers of the king and devoured some.

data.v: ततो हलहलाशब्दो नर्मदा तिर आबभौ । अर्जुनस्यानुयात्राणां रावणस्य च मन्त्रिणाम् ।।
data.md: There arose a dreadful uproar on the banks of Narmada, of the councillors of Răvana and Arjuna.

data.v: इषुभिस्तोमरैः शूलैर्वज्रकल्पैः सकर्षणैः । सरावणानर्दयन्तः समन्तात्समभिद्रुताः ।।
data.md: The warriors of Arjuna assailed Rāvana and his ministers with hundreds of arrows, Prāsas, darts, Tomaras, thunder-bolts and Karsanas.

data.v: हैहयाधिपयोधानां वेग आसीत्सुदारुणः । सनक्रमीनमकरसमुद्रस्येव निस्वनः ।।
data.md: The warriors of Arjuna became dreadfully furious and emitted cries like the roaring of the deep infested with crocodiles, fishes and other marine monsters.

data.v: रावणस्य तु तेऽमात्याः प्रहस्तशुकसारणाः । कार्तवीर्यबलं क्रुद्धा निर्दहन्त्यग्नितेजसः ।।
data.md: Thereupon being enraged and displaying their own prowess Suka, Sāraṇa and other ministers of Ravana began to destroy Arjuna's soldiers.

data.v: अर्जुनाय तु तत्कर्म रावणस्य समन्त्रिणः । क्रीडमानाय कथितं पुरुषैर्द्वाररक्षिभिः ।।
data.md: Thereupon the emissaries, stricken with fear, went to the sporting king and communicated to him the proceedings of Rāvana and his iministers.

data.v: उक्त्वा न भेतव्यमिति स्त्रीजनं स ततोऽर्जुनः । उत्ततार जलात्तस्माद्गङ्गातोयादिवाञ्जनः ।।
data.md: Hearing those words and saying to the females-"Do not fear” he rose up from the waters like an elephante

data.v: क्रोधदूषितनेत्रस्तु स ततोऽर्जुन पावकः । प्रजज्वाल महाघोरो युगान्त इव पावकः ।।
data.md: The eyes of that fire-like Arjuna were reddened with ire and he shone dreadfully like the fire of dissolution.

data.v: स तूर्णतरमादाय वरहेमाङ्गदो गदाम् । अभिद्रवति रक्षांसि तमांसीव दिवाकरः ।।
data.md: And taking up speedily his club, that one, always using golden clubs, pursued the Rakşasas like to darkness following the sun.

data.v: बाहुविक्षेपकरणां समुद्यम्य महागदाम् । गारुडं वेगमास्थाय आपपातैव सोऽर्जुनः ।।
data.md: Holding up the huge club and hurling it with his arms, Arjuna, resorting to the velocity of Garuda, went on

data.v: तस्य मर्गं समावृत्य विन्ध्योऽर्कस्येव पर्वतः । स्थितो विन्ध्य इवाकम्प्यः प्रहस्तो मुसलायुधः ।।
data.md: Thereupon stood there obstructing his course Raksasa, worked up with anger and with a mace in his hand, like to the Vindhya range standing in the way of the sun.

data.v: ततोऽस्य मुसलं घोरं लोहबद्धं मदोद्धतः । प्रहस्तः प्रेषयन्क्रुद्धो ररास च यथाम्बुदः ।।
data.md: And throwing down off his hand the iron mace, he, in anger, began to roar, like Yama.

data.v: तस्याग्रे मुसलस्याग्निरशोकापीडसंनिभः । प्रहस्तकरमुक्तस्य बभूव प्रदहन्निव ।।
data.md: And the top of the mace freed from the hand of Prahasta, was ablaze like the tips of Asoka flowers.

data.v: आधावमानं मुसलं कार्तवीर्यस्तदार्जुनः । निपुणं वञ्चयामास सगदो गजविक्रमः ।।
data.md: Not the least agitated on beholding that mace, the king Arjuna, by his club, baffled its action.

data.v: ततस्तमभिदुद्राव प्रहस्तं हैहयाधिपः । भ्रामयाणो गदां गुर्वीं पञ्चबाहुशतोच्छ्रयाम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon uplifting the huge club, five hundred hands long, the king of Haihayas pursued Prahasta.

data.v: तेनाहतोऽतिवेगेन प्रहस्तो गदया तदा । निपपात स्थितः शैलो वज्रिवज्रहतो यथा ।।
data.md: And within a short time being struck down by that club gifted with great velocity Prahasta fell down on earth like to the summit of a mountain clapped down by the thunder-bolt of Indra.

data.v: प्रहस्तं पतितं दृष्ट्वा मारीचशुकसारणाः । समहोदरधूम्राक्षा अपसृप्ता रणाजिरात् ।।
data.md: Beholding Prahasta fallen, Marica, Suka, Säraņa, Mahodara and Dhumrākṣa fled away from the battle-field.

data.v: अपक्रान्तेष्वमात्येषु प्रहस्ते च निपातिते । रावणोऽभ्यद्रवत्तूर्णमर्जुनं नृपसत्तमम् ।।
data.md: All the councillors having thus fled away and Prahasta being slain, Rāvaņa speedily proceeded towards Arjuna, the foremost of kings.

data.v: सहस्रबाहोस्तद्युद्धं विंशद्बाहोश्च दारुणम् । नृपराक्षसयोस्तत्र आरब्धं लोमहर्षणम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon there ensued a terrible encounter capable of making down erect between the thousand-armed Arjuna, the king of men, and the twenty-armed Ravana, the king of Raksasas.

data.v: सागराविव संक्षुब्धौ चलमूलाविवाचलौ । तेजोयुक्ताविवादित्यौ प्रदहन्ताविवानलौ ।।
बलोद्धतौ यथा नागौ वाशितार्थे यथा वृषौ । मेघाविव विनर्दन्तौ सिंहाविव बलोत्कटौ ।।
रुद्रकालाविव क्रुद्धौ तौ तथा राक्षसार्जुनौ । परस्परं गदाभ्यां तौ ताडयामासतुर्भृशम् ।।
वज्रप्रहारानचला यथा घोरान्विषेहिरे । गदाप्रहारांस्तद्वत्तौ सहेते नरराक्षसौ ।।
data.md: As the mountains suffer many clappings of thunder-bolts so did they bear many strokes.

data.v: यथाशनिरवेभ्यस्तु जायते वै प्रतिश्रुतिः । तथा ताभ्यां गदापातैर्दिशः सर्वाः प्रतिश्रुताः ।।
data.md: And all the quarters were resounded with the sound proceeding from the stroke of their clubs like to the sound of thunder-bolts.

data.v: अर्जुनस्य गदा सा तु पात्यमानाहितोरसि । काञ्चनाभं नभश्चक्रे विद्युत्सौदामनी यथा ।।
data.md: Being placed against the breast of Rāvaņa Arjuna's club rendered, for a moment, the welkin look like the burning gold as does the lightning.

data.v: तथैव रावणेनापि पात्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः । अर्जुनोरसि निर्भाति गदोल्केव महागिरौ ।।
data.md: And striking again and again against Arjuna's breast Ravana's club looked like a huge firebrand.

data.v: नार्जुनः खेदमाप्नोति न राक्षसगणेश्वरः । सममासीत्तयोर्युद्धं यथा पूर्वं बलीन्द्रयोः ।।
data.md: Neither Arjuna was worn out nor was Rāvaņa. And the conflict went on between them like the encounter between Bali and Våsava in the days of yore.

data.v: शृङ्गैर्महर्षभौ यद्वद्दन्ताग्रैरिव कुञ्जरौ । परस्परं विनिघ्नन्तौ नरराक्षससत्तमौ ।।
data.md: The King of men and the King of Rākşasas assailed and wounded one another with their clubs like to two bulls striking one another with their horns and two elephants with their tusks.

data.v: ततोऽर्जुनेन क्रुद्धेन सर्वप्राणेन सा गदा । स्तनयोरन्तरे मुक्ता रावणस्य महाहवे ।।
data.md: Thereupon worked up with rage, Arjuna, with his full might, smote Răvaņa on his breast, with his club.

data.v: वरदानकृतत्राणे सा गदा रावणोरसि । दुर्बलेव यथा सेना द्विधाभूतापतत्क्षितौ ।।
data.md: But Rāvana was well protected by the boon of the celestial, so the club fell on earth sundered into two pieces like one hurled by a weak wight.

data.v: स त्वर्जुनप्रमुक्तेन गदापातेन रावणः । अपासर्पद्धनुर्मात्रं निषसाद च निष्टनन् ।।
data.md: Still wounded by the mace of Arjuna, Rāvana, shedding tears, ran away at a distance of four feet and sat there.

data.v: स विह्वलं तदालक्ष्य दशग्रीवं ततोऽर्जुनः । सहसा प्रतिजग्राह गरुत्मानिव पन्नगम् ।।
स तं बाहुसहस्रेण बलाद्गृह्य दशाननम् । बबन्ध बलवान्राजा बलिं नारायणो यथा ।।
बध्यमाने दशग्रीवे सिद्धचारणदेवताः । साध्वीति वादिनः पुष्पैः किरन्त्यर्जुनमूर्धनि ।।
व्याघ्रो मृगमिवादाय सिंहराडिव दन्तिनम् । ररास हैहयो राजा हर्षादम्बुदवन्मुहुः ।।
data.md: And the king emitted leonine roars again and again as a tiger joyous roars like a cloud, holding a deer under his grasp.

data.v: प्रहस्तस्तु समाश्वस्तो दृष्ट्वा बद्धं दशाननम् । सह तै राकसैः क्रुद्ध अभिदुद्राव पार्थिवम् ।।
data.md: Regaining his sense and beholding Rāvana bound, Prahasta, in great anger, pursued, the King of Haihaya.

data.v: नक्तंचराणां वेगस्तु तेषामापततां बभौ । उद्धृत आतपापाये समुद्राणामिवाद्भुतः ।।
data.md: And the Rākşasa force grew tempestuous like to the rising of the ocean during rains.

data.v: मुञ्च मुञ्चेति भाषन्तस्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चासकृत् । मुसलानि च शूलानि उत्ससर्जुस्तदार्जुने ।।
data.md: Thereupon exclaiming repeatedly “Leave him off! Leave him off Wait! Wait!!" The Raksasa host hurled hundreds of Musalas and darts in the battle-field.

data.v: अप्राप्तान्येव तान्याशु असंभ्रान्तस्तदार्जुनः । आयुधान्यमरारीणां जग्राह रिपुसूदनः ।।
data.md: Not the least moved thereby the king Arjuna, the slayer of enemies, bore those weapons of the enemies of the celestials.

data.v: ततस्तैरेव रक्षांसि दुर्धरैः प्रवरायुधैः । भित्त्वा विद्रावयामास वायुरम्बुधरानिव ।।
data.md: Thereupon baffling the weapons of the Räkşasas by means of many a dreadful and excellent one, Arjuna, the king of Haihayas, drove them away · like winds scattering the clouds.

data.v: राक्षसांस्त्रासयित्वा तु कार्तवीर्यार्जुनस्तदा । रावणं गृह्य नगरं प्रविवेश सुहृद्वृतः ।।
स कीर्यमाणः कुसुमाक्षतोत्करै;र्द्विजैः सपौरैः पुरुहूतसंनिभः । तदार्जुनः संप्रविवेश तां पुरीं; बलिं निगृह्यैव सहस्रलोचनः ।।
data.md: Having thus struck terror to the night-rangers, he, encircled by his own kinsmen, repaired to his own city with Ravana, carrying him bound like to Indra carrying Bali bound. Thereupon flowers and fried paddy were showered upon him by the Brāhmaṇas and citizens.

data.v: रावणग्रहणं तत्तु वायुग्रहणसंनिभम् । ऋषिः पुलस्त्यः शुश्राव कथितं दिवि दैवतैः ।।
data.md: Thereupor Pulastya heard from the celestials ot the capture of Råvana like to the holding of the.wind.

data.v: ततः पुत्रसुतस्नेहात्कम्प्यमानो महाधृतिः । माहिष्मतीपतिं द्रष्टुमाजगाम महानृषिः ।।
data.md: Having seen moved by the love for his son, the highly effulgent, great ascetic, proceeded to see the king of Māhismati.

data.v: स वायुमार्गमास्थाय वायुतुल्यगतिर्द्विजः । पुरीं माहिष्मतीं प्राप्तो मनःसंतापविक्रमः ।।
data.md: Proceeding by the aerial way, that twice-born one, gifted with the velocity of wind and the flight of wind, reached the city of Māhismati.

data.v: सोऽमरावतिसंकाशां हृष्टपुष्टजनावृताम् । प्रविवेश पुरीं ब्रह्मा इन्द्रस्येवामरावतीम् ।।
data.md: Like to Brahma entering Indra's Amaravati, he entered the city resembling the capital of Indr and filled with delighted and plump citizens.

data.v: पादचारमिवादित्यं निष्पतन्तं सुदुर्दृशम् । ततस्ते प्रत्यभिज्ञाय अर्जुनाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.md: Beholding that dreadful Rșis approach like to Āditya walking on foot, the warders communicated the intelligence to the king Arjuna.

data.v: पुलस्त्य इति तं श्रुत्वा वचनं हैहयाधिपः । शिरस्यञ्जलिमुद्धृत्य प्रत्युद्गच्छद्द्विजोत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Understanding from their words that Pulastya was coming, the king of Haihayas, placing his folded palms on his crown, proceeded to welcome him.

data.v: पुरोहितोऽस्य गृह्यार्घ्यं मधुपर्कं तथैव च । पुरस्तात्प्रययौ राज्ञ इन्द्रस्येव बृहस्पतिः ।।
data.md: Like, to Brhaspati preceding Purandara, the royal priests went before him carrying, Madhuparka and water to wash feet.

data.v: ततस्तमृषिमायान्तमुद्यन्तमिव भास्करम् । अर्जुनो दृश्य संप्राप्तं ववन्देन्द्र इवेश्वरम् ।।
data.md: And beholding the ascetic resembling the rising sun arrived, the King Arjuna bowed to him reverentially like Indra saluting Mahadeva.

data.v: स तस्य मधुपर्कं च पाद्यमर्घ्यं च दापयन् । पुलस्त्यमाह राजेन्द्रो हर्षगद्गदया गिरा ।।
data.md: Thereupon offering him Madhuparka, cow and water to wash feet, the king of Haihayas, in accents obstructed with delight, addressed the ascetic saying

data.v: अद्येयममरावत्या तुल्या माहिष्मती कृता । अद्याहं तु द्विजेन्द्रेन्द्र यस्मात्पश्यामि दुर्दृशम् ।।
data.md: Reverend Sir, your visit, it is hard to obtain. On beholding you my city Mahişmati has been turned into Amaravati.

data.v: अद्य मे कुशलं देव अद्य मे कुलमुद्धृतम् । यत्ते देवगणैर्वन्द्यौ वन्देऽहं चरणाविमौ ।।
इदं राज्यमिमे पुत्रा इमे दारा इमे वयम् । ब्रह्मन्किं कुर्म किं कार्यमाज्ञापयतु नो भवान् ।।
तं धर्मेऽग्निषु भृत्येषु शिवं पृष्ट्वाथ पार्थिवम् । पुलस्त्योवाच राजानं हैहयानां तदार्जुनम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having enquired of the king about his piety, offerings and the well-being of his sons, Pulastya said to Arjuna, the king of Haihayas.

data.v: राजेन्द्रामलपद्माक्षपूर्णचन्द्रनिभानन । अतुलं ते बलं येन दशग्रीवस्त्वया जितः ।।
data.md: O foremost of kings, O you having eyes like lotus-petals! O you having a countenance like the full moon! When you have vanquished Ravaņa, your prowess is matchless in the triple world.

data.v: भयाद्यस्यावतिष्ठेतां निष्पन्दौ सागरानिलौ । सोऽयमद्य त्वया बद्धः पौत्रो मेऽतीवदुर्जयः ।।
data.md: You have bound up my invincible son in the conflict at whose fear the wind and the ocean stand still.

data.v: तत्पुत्रक यशः स्फीतं नाम विश्रावितं त्वया । मद्वाक्याद्याच्यमानोऽद्य मुञ्च वत्स दशाननम् ।।
data.md: Having drunk up the glories of my son you have announced your own; so I do say, O my son, do you release Dasanana.

data.v: पुलस्त्याज्ञां स गृह्याथ अकिंचनवचोऽर्जुनः । मुमोच पार्थिवेन्द्रेन्द्रो राक्षसेन्द्रं प्रहृष्टवत् ।।
data.md: Hearing this command of Pulastya, the king Arjuna did not utter a single world and set, most delightedly the king of Räkşasas, free.

data.v: स तं प्रमुक्त्वा त्रिदशारिमर्जुनः; प्रपूज्य दिव्याभरणस्रगम्बरैः । अहिंसाकं सख्यमुपेत्य साग्निकं; प्रणम्य स ब्रह्मसुतं गृहं ययौ ।।
data.md: Having released that foe of the celestials, worshipped him with celestials ornaments and garlands and established friendship removing all enmities with Ravana before fire, and bowed to Pulastya, the son of Brahmā, he repaired to his own house.

data.v: पुलस्त्येनापि संगम्य राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् । परिष्वङ्गकृतातिथ्यो लज्जमानो विसर्जितः ।।
data.md: And being released by the influence of Pulastya, the highly powerful Daśānana, the king of Raksasas, accepted his hospitality and being embraced by him, returned home ashamed.

data.v: पितामहसुतश्चापि पुलस्त्यो मुनिसत्तमः । मोचयित्वा दशग्रीवं ब्रह्मलोकं जगाम सः ।।
data.md: And having set Daśagriva at liberty Pulastya, the son of Brahma and the foremost of Munis repaired to the celestial region.

data.v: एवं स रावणः प्राप्तः कार्तवीर्यात्तु धर्षणात् । पुलस्त्यवचनाच्चापि पुनर्मोक्षमवाप्तवान् ।।
data.md: O Rāma, in this wise, the highly powerful Ravana was defeated by Arjuna and released by Pulastya.

data.v: एवं बलिभ्यो बलिनः सन्ति राघवनन्दन । नावज्ञा परतः कार्या य इच्छेच्छ्रेय आत्मनः ।।
data.md: Observe therefore, O descendant of Raghu, there is a mightier man than the mighty; therefore, one, desirous of his own well-being, should not disregard another.

data.v: ततः स राजा पिशिताशनानां; सहस्रबाहोरुपलभ्य मैत्रीम् । पुनर्नराणां कदनं चकार; चचार सर्वां पृथिवीं च दर्पात् ।।
data.md: Having acquired friendship with thousandarmed Arjuna, Daśānana, the king of Rākşasas, the world began again to journey over distressing the kings.

data.v: अर्जुनेन विमुक्तस्तु रावणो राक्षसाधिपः । चचार पृथिवीं सर्वामनिर्विण्णस्तथा कृतः ।।
data.md: Released by Arjuna, and yet not conceiving any shame, Rāvana, the king of Räkşasas again began to transverse the earth.

data.v: राक्षसं वा मनुष्यं वा शृणुते यं बलाधिकम् । रावणस्तं समासाद्य युद्धे ह्वयति दर्पितः ।।
data.md: Rākşasas or men, of whom the proud Rävaņa heard to be powerful he used to approach and summon them for fight.

data.v: ततः कदाचित्किष्किन्धां नगरीं वालिपालिताम् । गत्वाह्वयति युद्धाय वालिनं हेममालिनम् ।।
data.md: After some time he arrived at the city of Kişkindhā reared by Vāli and invited him, wearing golden garland, to fight.

data.v: ततस्तं वानरामात्यस्तारस्तारापिता प्रभुः । उवाच रावणं वाक्यं युद्धप्रेप्सुमुपागतम् ।।
data.md: Thereat, Tara, her father Susena and the Prince Sugrīva said to the king of Rākşasas.

data.v: राक्षसेन्द्र गतो वाली यस्ते प्रतिबलो भवेत् । नान्यः प्रमुखतः स्थातुं तव शक्तः प्लवंगमः ।।
data.md: O lord of Rākşasas, he is not present here, who shall be able to withstand you. What monkey else is capable of standing before you?

data.v: चतुर्भ्योऽपि समुद्रेभ्यः संध्यामन्वास्य रावण । इमं मुहूर्तमायाति वाली तिष्ठ मुहूर्तकम् ।।
data.md: However, O Ravana, Vali shall soon return after performing the Sandhya rites at the confluence of the four oceans; therefore wait here for a moment.

data.v: एतानस्थिचयान्पश्य य एते शङ्खपाण्डुराः । युद्धार्थिनामिमे राजन्वानराधिपतेजसा ।।
data.md: Behold, O Dasanana, there lie the bones of all those, like conch, who came ere this to fight with the powerful king of monkeys.

data.v: यद्वामृतरसः पीतस्त्वया रावणराक्षस । तथा वालिनमासाद्य तदन्तं तव जीवितम् ।।
data.md: O Ravana, O Raksasa, ever if you have drunk nectar, you shall at this very moment loose your life, when the encounter with Vāli shall take place.

data.v: अथ वा त्वरसे मर्तुं गच्छ दक्षिणसागरम् । वालिनं द्रक्ष्यसे तत्र भूमिष्ठमिव भास्करम् ।।
data.md: Or if you do wish to meet with death do you speedily repair to the southern ocean and you shall behold there Vali like to fire placed on earth.

data.v: स तु तारं विनिर्भर्त्स्य रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः । पुष्पकं तत्समारुह्य प्रययौ दक्षिणार्णवम् ।।
तत्र हेमगिरिप्रख्यं तरुणार्कनिभाननम् । रावणो वालिनं दृष्ट्वा संध्योपासनतत्परम् ।।
data.md: Hearing those words, Rāvana, the aggrandiser of the triple world, remonstrated with Tāra and ascending his flowery car went to the southern ocean and espied Vali, having red countenance like the rising sun, engaged in Sandhyā rites with whole-mindedness.

data.v: पुष्पकादवरुह्याथ रावणोऽञ्जनसंनिभः । ग्रहीतुं वालिनं तूर्णं निःशब्दपदमाद्रवत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having descended from his Puşpaka car he with silent approached Vāli to bring him under his grasp.

data.v: यदृच्छयोन्मीलयता वालिनापि स रावणः । पापाभिप्रायवान्दृष्टश्चकार न च संभ्रमम् ।।
शशमालक्ष्य सिंहो वा पन्नगं गरुडो यथा । न चिन्तयति तं वाली रावणं पापनिश्चयम् ।।
data.md: Casting his looks at pleasure, Vali saw him. Albeit apprised of his evil intention, he was not the least moved. And he did not care for him as a lion is not moved on beholding a hare and Garuda on beholding a serpent.

data.v: जिघृक्षमाणमद्यैनं रावणं पापबुद्धिनम् । कक्षावलम्बिनं कृत्वा गमिष्यामि महार्णवान् ।।
data.md: He then thought within himself-“This vicious-souled Răvaņa is approaching to catch me; holding him under my arm pit I shall journey over the three great oceans.

data.v: द्रक्ष्यन्त्यरिं ममाङ्कस्थं स्रंसितोरुकराम्बरम् । लम्बमानं दशग्रीवं गरुडस्येव पन्नगम् ।।
data.md: Everyone will behold the enemy Rāvana, under my arm pit as a serpent possessed by Garuda, with his thighs, arms and clothes loosened.

data.v: इत्येवं मतिमास्थाय वाली कर्णमुपाश्रितः । जपन्वै नैगमान्मन्त्रांस्तस्थौ पर्वतराडिव ।।
data.md: Having thought thus Vāli remained silent for sometime and reciting incantations he waited there like a mountain.

data.v: तावन्योन्यं जिघृक्षन्तौ हरिराक्षसपार्थिवौ । प्रयत्नवन्तौ तत्कर्म ईहतुर्बलदर्पितौ ।।
data.md: Thereupon the king of monkeys and the lord of Rākşasas, proud of strength, essayed to catch one another.

data.v: हस्तग्राह्यं तु तं मत्वा पादशब्देन रावणम् । पराङ्मुखोऽपि जग्राह वाली सर्पमिवाण्डजः ।।
data.md: Vāli was seated with his back (towards Rāvaņa); still from his footsteps he perceived that he had come within the grasp of Råvaņa's army and he at once caught hold of him like to Garuda holding a serpent.

data.v: ग्रहीतुकामं तं गृह्य रक्षसामीश्वरं हरिः । खमुत्पपात वेगेन कृत्वा कक्षावलम्बिनम् ।।
data.md: Getting hold of Rāvana, the lord of Rākşasas, desirous of catching him, (Vāli) and placing him under his arm-pit Vāli vehemently rose high up in the welkin.

data.v: स तं पीड्दयमानस्तु वितुदन्तं नखैर्मुहुः । जहार रावणं वाली पवनस्तोयदं यथा ।।
data.md: And he went away carrying him, scratching him again and again with his snails like to winds scattering clouds.

data.v: अथ ते राक्षसामात्या ह्रियमाणे दशानने । मुमोक्षयिषवो घोरा रवमाणा ह्यभिद्रवन् ।।
data.md: The Ten-necked demon being thus carried away, his councillors, to release him, pursued, exclaiming, Vali, in the welkin.

data.v: अन्वीयमानस्तैर्वाली भ्राजतेऽम्बरमध्यगः । अन्वीयमानो मेघौघैरम्बरस्थ इवांशुमान् ।।
data.md: They thus following him, Vali, appeared in the sky like the sun in the midst of clouds.

data.v: तेऽशक्नुवन्तः संप्राप्तं वालिनं राक्षसोत्तमाः । तस्य बाहूरुवेगेन परिश्रान्तः पतन्ति च ।।
data.md: The Rākşasas could not catch Vāli but were rather exhausted by the stroke of his arms and thighs.

data.v: वालिमार्गादपाक्रामन्पर्वतेन्द्रा हि गच्छतः ।।
data.md: What to speak of animals made of flesh and blood anxious for their lives even the mountains make way when Vāli goes.

data.v: अपक्षिगणसंपातो वानरेन्द्रो महाजवः । क्रमशः सागरान्सर्वान्संध्याकालमवन्दत ।।
data.md: Rising high up into the sky where even the birds cannot reach, Vali, the lord of monkeys and gifted with great velocity, by and by finished his Sandhyā rites above the oceans.

data.v: सभाज्यमानो भूतैस्तु खेचरैः खेचरो हरिः । पश्चिमं सागरं वाली आजगाम सरावणः ।।
data.md: Being worshipped by the aerials their lord, with Rāvaņa, first proceeded to the western ocean.

data.v: तत्र संध्यामुपासित्वा स्नात्वा जप्त्वा च वानरः । उत्तरं सागरं प्रायाद्वहमानो दशाननम् ।।
data.md: Having finished there Sandhyā prayers and recited incantations he, with Daśānana, went to the northern ocean.

data.v: उत्तरे सागरे संध्यामुपासित्वा दशाननम् । वहमानोऽगमद्वाली पूर्वमम्बुमहानिधिम् ।।
तत्रापि संध्यामन्वास्य वासविः स हरीश्वरः । किष्किन्धाभिमुखो गृह्य रावणं पुनरागमत् ।।
data.md: And having recited his prayers there also, Vali, the son of Indra, and the king of monkeys, carrying Rāvana, returned to the city of Kişikindhā.

data.v: चतुर्ष्वपि समुद्रेषु संध्यामन्वास्य वानरः । रावणोद्वहनश्रान्तः किष्किन्धोपवनेऽपतत् ।।
data.md: Having gone through his Sandhyā rites at the four oceans and carrying Răvaņa, that monkeychief was greatly exhausted and (therefore) descended into the gardens of Kişkindhā.

data.v: रावणं तु मुमोचाथ स्वकक्षात्कपिसत्तमः । कुतस्त्वमिति चोवाच प्रहसन्रावणं प्रति ।।
data.md: Having got out Răvaņa from his arm-pit, the foremost of monkeys, laughing again and again said:-"Where are you coming?"

data.v: विस्मयं तु महद्गत्वा श्रमलोकनिरीक्षणः । राक्षसेशो हरीशं तमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon being surprised greatly, Daśānana, the king of Rākşasas, with eyes, shaking with exhaustion, said to the king of monkeys.

data.v: वानरेन्द्र महेन्द्राभ राक्षसेन्द्रोऽस्मि रावणः । युद्धेप्सुरहं संप्राप्तः स चाद्यासादितस्त्वया ।।
data.md: O king of monkeys, resembling Mahendra, I am Rāvaņa, the king of Rākşasas; I came here to fight: but I have been defeated by you. Alas!

data.v: अहो बलमहो वीर्यमहो गम्भीरता च ते । येनाहं पशुवद्गृह्य भ्रामितश्चतुरोऽर्णवान् ।।
data.md: What strength is your! what prowess! What gravity! Holding me like a beast you have journeyed over the four oceans.

data.v: एवमश्रान्तवद्वीर शीघ्रमेव च वानर । मां चैवोद्वहमानस्तु कोऽन्यो वीरः क्रमिष्यति ।।
data.md: O hero! What heroic wight is there who is not exhausted by carrying me so vehemently?

data.v: त्रयाणामेव भूतानां गतिरेषा प्लवंगम । मनोऽनिलसुपर्णानां तव वा नात्र संशयः ।।
data.md: O monkey, mind, wind and Garuda-these three are gifted with the velocity. Undoubtedly you have got the same velocity.

data.v: सोऽहं दृष्टबलस्तुभ्यमिच्छामि हरिपुंगव । त्वया सह चिरं सख्यं सुस्निग्धं पावकाग्रतः ।।
data.md: Your prowess has been sufficiently displayed. But bow I wish, O king of monkeys, to make friends with you for ever before fire.

data.v: दाराः पुत्राः पुरं राष्ट्रं भोगाच्छादनभोजनम् । सर्वमेवाविभक्तं नौ भविष्यति हरीश्वर ।।
data.md: O king of monkeys, from today, wife sons, city, kingdom, enjoyment, cloth and food shall be our common,

data.v: ततः प्रज्वालयित्वाग्निं तावुभौ हरिराक्षसौ । भ्रातृत्वमुपसंपन्नौ परिष्वज्य परस्परम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having lighted up fire the king of monkeys and the king of Rākşasas, embracing each other, became friends.

data.v: अन्योन्यं लम्बितकरौ ततस्तौ हरिराक्षसौ । किष्किन्धां विशतुर्हृष्टौ सिंहौ गिरिगुहामिव ।।
data.md: Thereupon holding each other by the arms they entered the city of Kiskindha like to two lions, entering delightedly a cave.

data.v: स तत्र मासमुषितः सुग्रीव इव रावणः । अमात्यैरागतैर्नीचस्त्रैलोक्योत्सादनार्थिभिः ।।
data.md: There like Sugrīva Răvaņa spent a month. Afterwards his councillors, desirous of destroying the triple world, took him away.

data.v: एवमेतत्पुरावृत्तं वालिना रावणः प्रभो । धर्षितश्च कृतश्चापि भ्राता पावकसंनिधौ ।।
data.md: O lord Răma, I have thus related to you the previous history. Having thus belaboured Rāvaņa Vālī at last made friends with him before fire.

data.v: बलमप्रतिमं राम वालिनोऽभवदुत्तमम् । सोऽपि तया विनिर्दग्धः शलभो वह्निना यथा ।।
data.md: O Rama, Vali and unequalled and great strength. Like to fire burning down locusts you did burn down Vali.

data.v: अपृच्छत ततो रामो दक्षिणाशालयं मुनिम् । प्राञ्जलिर्विनयोपेत इदमाह वचोऽर्थवत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon Rāma, being stricken with curiosity, with folded palms and humbly accosted Agastya, residing in the southern quarter, with pregnant accents, saying.

data.v: अतुलं बलमेताभ्यां वालिनो रावणस्य च । न त्वेतौ हनुमद्वीर्यैः समाविति मतिर्मम ।।
शौर्यं दाक्ष्यं बलं धैर्यं प्राज्ञता नयसाधनम् । विक्रमश्च प्रभावश्च हनूमति कृतालयाः ।।
data.md: Heroism, liberality, strength, patience, intellect, knowledge of lawn and means, prowess and energy all exist together in Hanuman. on

data.v: दृष्ट्वोदधिं विषीदन्तीं तदैष कपिवाहिनीम् । समाश्वास्य कपीन्भूयो योजनानां शतं प्लुतः ।।
data.md: When the monkey host lost heart beholding the ocean, Hanumān, consoling crossed over the deep extending over a hundred leagues.

data.v: धर्षयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कां रावणान्तःपुरं तथा । दृष्ट्वा संभाषिता चापि सीता विश्वासिता तथा ।।
data.md: Having discarded the presiding goddess of Lanka he went to the mansion of Rāvana and on beholding Sita there, he consoled her.

data.v: सेनाग्रगा मन्त्रिसुताः किंकरा रावणात्मजः । एते हनुमता तत्र एकेन विनिपातिताः ।।
data.md: What to speak of more, Hanuman, singlehanded, slew Ravana's commander-in-chief, the minister's son, his servants and his one son.

data.v: भूयो बन्धाद्विमुक्तेन संभाषित्वा दशाननम् । लङ्का भस्मीकृता तेन पावकेनेव मेदिनी ।।
data.md: Being released from the Brahma weapon Hanuman remonstrated with Rāvaņa, and reduced Larkā into ashes like to fire burning down earth.

data.v: न कालस्य न शक्रस्य न विष्णोर्वित्तपस्य च । कर्माणि तानि श्रूयन्ते यानि युद्धे हनूमतः ।।
data.md: What I have seen myself performed by Hanumān in the conflict is above the power of Kala, Vasava and even the lord of riches.

data.v: एतस्य बाहुवीर्येण लङ्का सीता च लक्ष्मणः । प्राप्तो मया जयश्चैव राज्यं मित्राणि बान्धवाः ।।
data.md: It is by the strength of the arms of that Windgod's son I ave obtained Lanka, Sita, Lakşmaņa, Victory, kingdom and my friends.

data.v: हनूमान्यदि मे न स्याद्वानराधिपतेः सखा । प्रवृत्तमपि को वेत्तुं जानक्याः शक्तिमान्भवेत् ।।
data.md: What more, had not Hanumăn, the friend of the king of monkeys-Sugrīva, been in my company who could have brought Sītā intelligence?

data.v: किमर्थं वाली चैतेन सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया । तदा वैरे समुत्पन्ने न दग्धो वीरुधो यथा ।।
data.md: Why did not Hanumän, although wishing welfare to Sugrīva, reduce Vāli to ashes like so many creepers on the occasion of his quarrel with Sugriva?

data.v: न हि वेदितवान्मन्ये हनूमानात्मनो बलम् । यद्दृष्टवाञ्जीवितेष्टं क्लिश्यन्तं वानराधिपम् ।।
data.md: Methinks, Hanuman was not cognisant of his own prowess then? And therefore he did stood to witness the miseries of Sugrīva— the king of monkeys who was dearer than his life.

data.v: एतन्मे भगवन्सर्वं हनूमति महामुने । विस्तरेण यथातत्त्वं कथयामरपूजित ।।
data.md: O you worshipped of the immortals, do you truly describe to me in detail this action of Hanuman.

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा हेतुयुक्तमृषिस्ततः । हनूमतः समक्षं तमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Hearing those well-meaning words of Rāghava, the ascetic Agastya said to him in the presence of Hanumān.

data.v: सत्यमेतद्रघुश्रेष्ठ यद्ब्रवीषि हनूमतः । न बले विद्यते तुल्यो न गतौ न मतौ परः ।।
data.md: O foremost of Raghus, what, you have said regarding Hanumān, is all true. As regards, strength, velocity and intellect there is none who can equal Hanuman.

data.v: अमोघशापैः शापस्तु दत्तोऽस्य ऋषिभिः पुरा । न वेदिता बलं येन बली सन्नरिमर्दनः ।।
data.md: O repressor of enemies, in the days of yore Hanumān was imprecated by the ascetics, whose curses never become fruitless, to the effect that he would never be conscious of his whole strength.

data.v: बाल्येऽप्येतेन यत्कर्म कृतं राम महाबल । तन्न वर्णयितुं शक्यमतिबालतयास्य ते ।।
data.md: I am not capable of describing to you the wondrous childish feat which Hanuman did perform in his boyhood.

data.v: यदि वास्ति त्वभिप्रायस्तच्छ्रोतुं तव राघव । समाधाय मतिं राम निशामय वदाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: But if you are, O Raghava, greatly anxious to hear it, I shall relate do you hear with a quiescent mind.

data.v: सूर्यदत्तवरस्वर्णः सुमेरुर्नाम पर्वतः । यत्र राज्यं प्रशास्त्यस्य केसरी नाम वै पिता ।।
data.md: Hanuman's father Keśarī reigned in the mountain Sumeru which resembles gold by the influence of the sun.

data.v: तस्य भार्या बभूवेष्टा ह्यञ्जनेति परिश्रुता । जनयामास तस्यां वै वायुरात्मजमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Kesari had a well-known wife by the name of Añjanā to whom he was greatly attached. The deity Wind begot on Añjană an excellent son.

data.v: शालिशूकसमाभासं प्रासूतेमं तदाञ्जना । फलान्याहर्तुकामा वै निष्क्रान्ता गहने चरा ।।
data.md: Repairing to a dense forest for collecting fruits, the excellent damsel gave birth to Hanumān resembling the tip of a ſala tree and went away.

data.v: एष मातुर्वियोगाच्च क्षुधया च भृशार्दितः । रुरोद शिशुरत्यर्थं शिशुः शरभराडिव ।।
data.md: Being distressed with hunger on account of the absence of the mother, Hanuman, just born, cried like Kartikeya, the commander-in-chief of the celestials, in the forest of Saras.

data.v: ततोद्यन्तं विवस्वन्तं जपापुष्पोत्करोपमम् । ददृशे फललोभाच्च उत्पपात रविं प्रति ।।
data.md: At this time the sun resembling Japā flowers, having risen, Hanumān, to get a fruit, sprang up.

data.v: बालार्काभिमुखो बालो बालार्क इव मूर्तिमान् । ग्रहीतुकामो बालार्कं प्लवतेऽम्बरमध्यगः ।।
data.md: Being desirous of holding the newly risen sun, Hanumān, resembling it, began to leap in the middle of the welkin.

data.v: एतस्मिन्प्लवमाने तु शिशुभावे हनूमति । देवदानवसिद्धानां विस्मयः सुमहानभूत् ।।
data.md: The child Hanuman having thus ascended the sky, celestials, Dānavas and Yakşas surprisingly exclaimed.

data.v: नाप्येवं वेगवान्वायुर्गरुडो न मनस्तथा । यथायं वायुपुत्रस्तु क्रमतेऽम्बरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: The velocity, with which Marut's son is going, is not possessed even by the Wind, Garuda and mind.

data.v: यदि तावच्छिशोरस्य ईदृशौ गतिविक्रमौ । यौवनं बलमासाद्य कथं वेगो भविष्यति ।।
data.md: If he has got such vehemence in his boyhood what great strength he shall have in his youth.

data.v: तमनुप्लवते वायुः प्लवन्तं पुत्रमात्मनः । सूर्यदाहभयाद्रक्षंस्तुषारचयशीतलः ।।
data.md: His own son thus leaping, the wind, becoming cool by the touch of snow, began to follow him proceeding in the sky lest the rays of the sun might scorch him.

data.v: बहुयोजनसाहस्रं क्रमत्येष ततोऽम्बरम् । पितुर्बलाच्च बाल्याच्च भास्कराभ्याशमागतः ।।
data.md: Rising high up in the sky on account of childish freaks and traversed many thousand leagues by the help of his father Hanuman neared the sun.

data.v: शिशुरेष त्वदोषज्ञ इति मत्वा दिवाकरः । कार्यं चात्र समायत्तमित्येवं न ददाह सः ।।
data.md: Considering that he was a mere child and therefore not tarnished by any sin and that a great divine work would be accomplished by him in future the sun did not burn Hanuman.

data.v: यमेव दिवसं ह्येष ग्रहीतुं भास्करं प्लुतः । तमेव दिवसं राहुर्जिघृक्षति दिवाकरम् ।।
data.md: At the every day when Hanuman sprang up to hold the sun, Rāhu too essayed to possess him.

data.v: अनेन च परामृष्टो राम सूर्यरथोपरि । अपक्रान्तस्ततस्त्रस्तो राहुश्चन्द्रार्कमर्दनः ।।
data.md: Having reached the top of the sun's car Hanuman touched Rāhu; so he, the repressor of the moon's rays, accordingly went back on beholding the sun thus possessed.

data.v: स इन्द्रभवनं गत्वा सरोषः सिंहिकासुतः । अब्रवीद्भ्रुकुटीं कृत्वा देवं देवगणैर्वृतम् ।।
data.md: And repairing to the house of Indra, Sinhika's son, in wrath and with frowns, said to him encircled by the celestials.

data.v: बुभुक्षापनयं दत्त्वा चन्द्रार्कौ मम वासव । किमिदं तत्त्वया दत्तमन्यस्य बलवृत्रहन् ।।
data.md: O Vasava! O slayer of Bala and Vrtra-to remove my hunger you did give me both the sun and moon; why you have then given them to another?

data.v: अद्याहं पर्वकाले तु जिघृक्षुः सूर्यमागतः । अथान्यो राहुरासाद्य जग्राह सहसा रविम् ।।
data.md: On account of the Parva I came to devour the sun but another Rahu came and possessed him.

data.v: स राहोर्वचनं श्रुत्वा वासवः संभ्रमान्वितः । उत्पपातासनं हित्वा उद्वहन्काञ्चनस्रजम् ।।
ततः कैलासकूटाभं चतुर्दन्तं मदस्रवम् । शृङ्गारकारिणं प्रांशुं स्वर्णघण्टाट्टहासिनम् ।।
इन्द्रः करीन्द्रमारुह्य राहुं कृत्वा पुरःसरम् । प्रायाद्यत्राभवत्सूर्यः सहानेन हनूमता ।।
अथातिरभसेनागाद्राहुरुत्सृज्य वासवम् । अनेन च स वै दृष्ट आधावञ्शैलकूटवत् ।।
data.md: Having left behind Indra, Rāhu, quickly went there but fled away on beholding the hugebodied Hanumān resembling a mountain summit.

data.v: ततः सूर्यं समुत्सृज्य राहुमेवमवेक्ष्य च । उत्पपात पुनर्व्योम ग्रहीतुं सिंहिकासुतम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon leaving aside the sun and being desirous of holding Rāhu, the son of Siṁhikā considering him as a fruit, Hanumān again sprang up into the sky.

data.v: उत्सृज्यार्कमिमं राम आधावन्तं प्लवंगमम् । दृष्ट्वा राहुः परावृत्य मुखशेषः पराङ्मुखः ।।
data.md: Beholding Hanuman approach renouncing the sun, Rāhu with his countenance only visible, desisted and went back.

data.v: इन्द्रमाशंसमानस्तु त्रातारं सिंहिकासुतः । इन्द्र इन्द्रेति संत्रासान्मुहुर्मुहुरभाषत ।।
data.md: And considering Indra as the saviour the son of Simhikā, stricken with fear, again and again cried aloud "Indra! Indra!!"

data.v: राहोर्विक्रोशमानस्य प्रागेवालक्षितः स्वरः । श्रुत्वेन्द्रोवाच मा भैषीरयमेनं निहन्म्यहम् ।।
data.md: Understanding everything by the piteous accents of Rāhu Indra said, “No fear, I shall soon slay him.”

data.v: ऐरावतं ततो दृष्ट्वा महत्तदिदमित्यपि । फलं तं हस्तिराजानमभिदुद्राव मारुतिः ।।
data.md: Thereupon beholding the huge-bodied Airāvat and considering him as a bigger fruit Măruti ran towards him.

data.v: तदास्य धावतो रूपमैरावतजिघृक्षया । मुहूर्तमभवद्घोरमिन्द्राग्न्योरिव भास्वरम् ।।
data.md: Proceeding thus tempestuously when he rose above the head of Indra, Hanuman, looked in a moment dreadful like the fire of dissolution.

data.v: एवमाधावमानं तु नातिक्रुद्धः शचीपतिः । हस्तान्तेनातिमुक्तेन कुलिशेनाभ्यताडयत् ।।
data.md: But not greatly enraged the thousand-eyed lord of Saci, with the thunder bolt in his hand, struck the running Hanumān.

data.v: ततो गिरौ पपातैष इन्द्रवज्राभिताडितः । पतमानस्य चैतस्य वामो हनुरभज्यत ।।
data.md: Belaboured by the thunder-bolt of Indra Hanuman fell down on a summit and broke his left jaw.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु पतिते बाले वज्रताडनविह्वले । चुक्रोधेन्द्राय पवनः प्रजानामशिवाय च ।।
data.md: He being thus overwhelmed by the stoke of Indra's thunder-bolt, the Wind-god became displeased with the king of celestials and was determined upon bringing about mischief to all created beings.

data.v: विण्मूत्राशयमावृत्य प्रजास्वन्तर्गतः प्रभुः । रुरोध सर्वभूतानि यथा वर्षाणि वासवः ।।
