data.md: The high-minded Śatrughna being beside himself with rage, from all his person issued burning lustre.

data.v: उवाच च सुसंक्रुद्धः शत्रुघ्नस्तं निशाचरम् । योद्धुमिच्छामि दुर्बुद्धे द्वन्द्वयुद्धं त्वया सह ।।
data.md: Greatly enraged he said to the night-ranger O you of a vicious intellect, I wish to enter into a dual encounter with you.

data.v: पुत्रो दशरथस्याहं भ्राता रामस्य धीमतः । शत्रुघ्नो नाम शत्रुघ्नो वधाकाङ्क्षी तवागतः ।।
data.md: I am the son of the great king Dasaratha, brother of the intelligent Rāma and my name is Satrughna. I slay all my enemies and have come here to destroy you.

data.v: तस्य मे युद्धकामस्य द्वन्द्वयुद्धं प्रदीयताम् । शत्रुस्त्वं सर्वजीवानां न मे जीवन्गमिष्यसि ।।
data.md: I wish now to fight with you-do you enter into a dual conflict. You are the enemy of all animals. You shall not be able to survive at my hands.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तथा ब्रुवाणे तु राक्षसः प्रहसन्निव । प्रत्युवाच नरश्रेष्ठं दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि दुर्मते ।।
data.md: He having said this, the Rākṣasa, laughing aloud, replied to that foremost of men:-Your understanding is bewildered. By the influence of destiny you have come under my control.

data.v: मम मातृष्वसुर्भ्राता रावणो नाम राक्षसः । हतो रामेण दुर्बुद्धे स्त्रीहेतोः पुरुषाधम ।।
data.md: The Räksasa Rāvana was the brother of my aunts. O you of vicious understanding, O vile wight, it is for his wife that Rāma did slay him.

data.v: तच्च सर्वं मया क्षान्तं रावणस्य कुलक्षयम् । अवज्ञां पुरतः कृत्वा मया यूयं विशेषतः ।।

data.md: You are all vile men; I have slain and defeated all of your family that have passed away and shall destroy all that are living and shall come into existence.

data.md: O you of vicious intellect, if you wish I shall fight with you. Do you wait here so long I do not bring my weapon.

data.md: The practical men should never let off the enemies who come out of their own accord. He, who invite an enemy into battle under the influence of perverted understanding, is slain like a coward.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भाषितं तस्य शत्रुघ्नस्य महात्मनः । क्रोधमाहारयत्तीव्रं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the high-souled Śatrughna Lavaņa was greatly enraged and again and again asked him to wait.

data.md: Clashing his hands and grinding his teeth he invited that foremost of Raghus to fight.

data.v: तं ब्रुवाणं तथा वाक्यं लवणं घोरविक्रमम् । शत्रुघ्नो देव शत्रुघ्न इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: And Satrughna, the slayer of celestial's enemies, said to the dreadful Lavaņa, giving vent to those words.

data.md: Śatrughna was not born when you did defeat other kings; do you therefore proceed to Death's abode being assailed by shafts.

data.v: ऋषयोऽप्यद्य पापात्मन्मया त्वां निहतं रणे । पश्यन्तु विप्रा विद्वांसस्त्रिदशा इव रावणम् ।।
data.md: O you of a vicious soul, as did the celestials behold Rāvana slain so shall the Rșis and learned Brāhmaṇas behold you, destroyed by me.

data.v: त्वयि मद्बाणनिर्दग्धे पतितेऽद्य निशाचर । पुरं जनपदं चापि क्षेममेतद्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: O Rākşasa, forsooth shall good crown cities and villages when you shall fall down brunt by my arrow.

data.md: As the rays of the sun enter into lotus so shall arrows, hard as lightning, discharged by my hands, shall enter into your heart.

data.md: Being beside himself with ire on hearing those words of Śatrughna, Lavaņa threw a huge tree against his breast. And ſatrughna too sundered it into a hundred pieces.

data.md: Beholding his own action baffled the Rākşasa again took up many trees and hurled them at Śatrughna, who, with three or four hundred bent arrow, cut them all, one by one, into pieces.

data.md: Beholding his own action baffled the Rākşasa again took up many trees and hurled them at Śatrughna, who, with three or four hundred bent arrow, cut them all, one by one, into pieces.

data.v: ततो बाणमयं वर्षं व्यसृजद्राक्षसोरसि । शत्रुघ्नो वीर्यसंपन्नो विव्यथे न च राक्षसः ।।
data.md: Thereupon when the powerful Satrughna assailed him with arrows the Rākşasa was not the least pained.

data.v: ततः प्रहस्य लवणो वृक्षमुत्पाट्य लीलया । शिरस्यभ्यहनच्छूरं स्रस्ताङ्गः स मुमोह वै ।।
data.md: Rather laughing aloud the valiant Räksasa uprooted a tree and struck him with that on the head. With that stroke he was wounded and slain.

data.v: तस्मिन्निपतिते वीरे हाहाकारो महानभूत् । ऋषीणां देव संघानां गन्धर्वाप्सरसामपि ।।
data.md: And that hero falling there arose a terrible uproar among the Rșis, celestials, Gandharvas and Apsarās.

data.v: तमवज्ञाय तु हतं शत्रुघ्नं भुवि पातितम् । रक्षो लब्धान्तरमपि न विवेश स्वमालयम् ।।
data.md: There upon considering Śatrughna slain the night-ranger did not enter his house albeit he got the opportunity; and moreover beholding him fallen and destroyed he did not take up his dart. He then began to carry his collected food.

data.md: There upon considering Śatrughna slain the night-ranger did not enter his house albeit he got the opportunity; and moreover beholding him fallen and destroyed he did not take up his dart. He then began to carry his collected food.

data.v: मुहूर्ताल्लब्धसंज्ञस्तु पुनस्तस्थौ धृतायुधः । शत्रुघ्नो राक्षसद्वारि ऋषिभिः संप्रपूजितः ।।
data.md: Regaining his sense within a moment, Śatrughna, with a weapon in his hand, stood at the city gate and the Rșis began to praise him.

data.v: ततो दिव्यममोघं तं जग्राह शरमुत्तमम् । ज्वलन्तं तेजसा घोरं पूरयन्तं दिशो दश ।।
data.md: There upon, he having taken up an excellent arrow of unfailing aim the ten quarters were filled with its native brilliance.

data.v: वज्राननं वज्रवेगं मेरुमन्दर गौरवम् । नतं पर्वसु सर्वेषु संयुगेष्वपराजितम् ।।
data.md: Its face was like lightning and its velocity the same and it looked like Meru and Mandāra; its joints were all bent. None could defeat it in battle.

data.md: It was pasted with red sandal resembling blood and its feathers were beautiful. Beholding that dart like to the fire of dissolution, and dreadful to lords of Dānavas, mountains and Asuras, the creatures were greatly terrified.

data.md: It was pasted with red sandal resembling blood and its feathers were beautiful. Beholding that dart like to the fire of dissolution, and dreadful to lords of Dānavas, mountains and Asuras, the creatures were greatly terrified.

data.md: What more, being disturbed, the celestials, Asuras, Gandharvas, saints and Apsarās and all other creatures of the world approached the Great Patriarch, the conferrer of boons and said. The fear of the celestials and the destruction of the creatures has arrived.

data.md: Hearing those words the Patriarch Brahmă replied Although it is a source of great fear still it is not dreadful to the celestials. There upon with sweet accents he said:-Hear, O you celestials, ſatrughna has taken up this arrow for the destruction of Pavana.

data.v: वधाय लवणस्याजौ शरः शत्रुघ्नधारितः । तेजसा यस्य सर्वे स्म संमूढाः सुरसत्तमाः ।।

एवमेतं प्रजानीध्वं विष्णोस्तेजोमयं शरम् । एषा चैव तनुः पूर्वा विष्णोस्तस्य महात्मनः ।।

data.md: Vişņu alone is cognisant of its energy. This Śatrughna is the first portion of Vişnu's person; do you all go hence and behold the destruction of the foremost Raksasa, Lavana, by the highsouled, heroic Satrughna, the younger brother of Rama.

data.v: तस्य ते देवदेवस्य निशम्य मधुरां गिरम् । आजग्मुर्यत्र युध्येते शत्रुघ्नलवणावुभौ ।।
तं शरं दिव्यसंकाशं शत्रुघ्नकरधारितम् । ददृशुः सर्वभूतानि युगान्ताग्निमिवोत्थितम् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the Patriarch Brahmă, the celestials arrived at the battle-field of Šatrughna and Lavana and saw that the arrow, held by Satrughna's hands, was burning like the fire of dissolution.

data.v: आकाशमावृतं दृष्ट्वा देवैर्हि रघुनन्दनः । सिंहनादं मुहुः कृत्वा ददर्श लवणं पुनः ।।
data.md: Beholding the welkin covered by the celestials, Satrughna, the descendant of Raghu, emitting leonine roars, again and again looked towards Lavaņa. And being again excited by the high-souled Śatrughna and enraged Lavaņa arrived for encounter.

data.v: आहूतश्च ततस्तेन शत्रुघ्नेन महात्मना । लवणः क्रोधसंयुक्तो युद्धाय समुपस्थितः ।।
data.md: Beholding the welkin covered by the celestials, Satrughna, the descendant of Raghu, emitting leonine roars, again and again looked towards Lavaņa. And being again excited by the high-souled Śatrughna and enraged Lavaņa arrived for encounter.

data.v: आकर्णात्स विकृष्याथ तद्धनुर्धन्विनां वरः । स मुमोच महाबाणं लवणस्य महोरसि । उरस्तस्य विदार्याशु प्रविवेश रसातलम् ।।
data.md: There upon expanding his bow up to ears, Satrughna, the the most accomplished archer, discharged his arrow against the spacious breast of Lavaņa. data.v: गत्वा रसातलं दिव्यं शरो विबुधपूजितः । पुनरेवागमत्तूर्णमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम् ।।

data.md: And being pierced by that shaft the nightranger Lavaņa fell down on earth like a mountain clapped by a thunder-bolt.

data.md: The Rākşasa being slain that celestial, huge arrow came into the possession of Rudra before the gods.

data.v: एकेषुपातेन भयं निहत्य; लोकत्रयस्यास्य रघुप्रवीरः । विनिर्बभावुद्यतचापबाण;स्तमः प्रणुद्येव सहस्ररश्मिः ।।
data.md: Having removed the fear of the three worlds with one shaft, that heroic Raghu, Satrughnayounger brother of Lakşmaņa, holding excellent bow and arrow, appeared like the Sun of thousand rays removing darkness.

data.v: हते तु लवणे देवाः सेन्द्राः साग्निपुरोगमाः । ऊचुः सुमधुरां वाणीं शत्रुघ्नं शत्रुतापनम् ।।
data.md: Lavana being slain the celestials headed by Agni and Indra said in sweet accents to Śatrughna the represser of enemies.

data.v: दिष्ट्या ते विजयो वत्स दिष्ट्या लवणराक्षसः । हतः पुरुषशार्दूल वरं वरय राघव ।।
data.md: O child, fortunate it is that you have been crowned with success after slaying the Rākṣasa Lavaņa. Do you, therefore, O foremost of men, O you of firm vows, accept boons.

data.v: वरदाः स्म महाबाहो सर्व एव समागताः । विजयाकाङ्क्षिणस्तुभ्यममोघं दर्शनं हि नः ।।
data.md: O you having long arms, all those who can confer boons have arrived here; they all wish for your victory; seeing us does not go without fruits.

data.md: Let this picturesque and charming city of Madhu, built by the celestials, by my capital; this is the only excellent boon I can beg.

data.v: तं देवाः प्रीतमनसो बाढमित्येव राघवम् । भविष्यति पुरी रम्या शूरसेना न संशयः ।।
data.md: The celestials, with a delighted heart, said to the descendant of Raghu.-Your desire shall be fulfilled and forsooth shall your city be turned into a picturesque capital under the name of Surasena.

data.md: The high-souled celestials having ascended the welkin saying this, the highly effulgent Śatrughna brought the soldiers there, that were encamped on the banks of the Gangā.

data.md: When the soldiers arrived there on hearing the commands of Satrughna he engaged in making encampments in the month of Śrāvan.

data.md: In this wise the fearlessness of the celestial host, taking the shape of a country, that beautiful and picturesque city was reared in the course of twelve years. data.md: Having thus reared the beautiful city he resolved within himself The twelfth year has come. I shall now behold the feet of Rāma.

data.md: Having prevented his minister and leading generals he proceeded with one hundred chariots and cavalry.

data.md: There upon having entered the highly picturesque city Ayodhyā, city Ayodhyā, the graceful descendant of Ikşvākus, ſatrughna, reached where the long-armed and the highly effulgent Råma was waiting.

data.v: सोऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं ज्वलन्तमिव तेजसा । उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् ।।
data.md: He espied there Rāma in the midst of the councillors like Indra among the immortals burning in his own effulgence. And having bowed with folded hands to Răma, having truth for his prowess, Śatrughna, said.

data.v: यदाज्ञप्तं महाराज सर्वं तत्कृतवानहम् । हतः स लवणः पापः पुरी सा च निवेशिता ।।
द्वादशं च गतं वर्षं त्वां विना रघुनन्दन । नोत्सहेयमहं वस्तुं त्वया विरहितो नृप ।।
data.md: O great king, I have carried out all your behests; I have slain the vicious Lavaņa and filled his city with subjects. O descendant of Raghu, twelve years have passed away without you, I do not wish to live any longer separated from you.

data.v: स मे प्रसादं काकुत्स्थ कुरुष्वामितविक्रम । मातृहीनो यथा वत्सस्त्वां विना प्रवसाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: Do you therefore, O Kākutstha of unmitigated prowess, have compassion on me. Without you, I cannot live for ever in a foreign province like a motherless child.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं शत्रुघ्नं परिष्वज्येदमब्रवीत् । मा विषादं कृथा वीर नैतत्क्षत्रियचेष्टितम् ।।
data.md: He having said this, Rāma embraced him and said: Be not sorry O hero. This is not a becoming action for Kşatriyas.

data.v: नावसीदन्ति राजानो विप्रवासेषु राघव । प्रजाश्च परिपाल्या हि क्षत्रधर्मेण राघव ।।
data.md: The kings, O Raghava, are never tired of living in a foreign land. According to the morality of the Kșatriyas, their greatest duty consists in governing the subjects.

data.v: काले काले च मां वीर अयोध्यामवलोकितुम् । आगच्छ त्वं नरश्रेष्ठ गन्तासि च पुरं तव ।।
data.md: O heroic and foremost of men, do you, at intervals, come to Ayodhyå to see me and return to your own city.

data.v: ममापि त्वं सुदयितः प्राणैरपि न संशयः । अवश्यं करणीयं च राज्यस्य परिपालनम् ।।
data.md: Forsooth you are dearer than my life. But it is an incumbent duty to govern the kingdom. Do you therefore, O Kakutstha, live with me for seven nights, and afterwards return to your city with your servants, army and conveyances.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वं वस काकुत्स्थ पञ्चरात्रं मया सह । ऊर्ध्वं गन्तासि मधुरां सभृत्यबलवाहनः ।।
data.md: Forsooth you are dearer than my life. But it is an incumbent duty to govern the kingdom. Do you therefore, O Kakutstha, live with me for seven nights, and afterwards return to your city with your servants, army and conveyances.

data.v: रामस्यैतद्वचः श्रुत्वा धर्मयुक्तं मनोऽनुगम् । शत्रुघ्नो दीनया वाचा बाढमित्येव चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Hearing those moral and charming words of Rama, Satrughna poorly replied, saying: Your command shall be carried out.

data.v: स पञ्चरात्रं काकुत्स्थो राघवस्य यथाज्ञया । उष्य तत्र महेष्वासो गमनायोपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Thereupon Satrughna, well-skilled in the use of bows, remained with Rāma for seven nights and then addressed himself for departure.

data.v: आमन्त्र्य तु महात्मानं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् । भरतं लक्ष्मणं चैव महारथमुपारुहत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having invited Bharata and Laksmana, the high-souled Rama, having truth for his prowess, speedily went for his city in a huge chariot.

data.v: दूरं ताभ्यामनुगतो लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना । भरतेन च शत्रुघ्नो जगामाशु पुरीं तदा ।।
data.md: The high-souled Lakşmaņa and slayer of enemies Bharata followed him on foot for some distance.

data.v: प्रस्थाप्य तु स शत्रुघ्नं भ्रातृभ्यां सह राघवः । प्रमुमोद सुखी राज्यं धर्मेण परिपालयन् ।।
data.md: Having bade adieu to Satrughna, Rama, the descendant of Raghu, was greatly delighted by governing his subjects piously in the company of Bharata and Laksmana.

data.v: ततः कतिपयाहःसु वृद्धो जानपदो द्विजः । शवं बालमुपादाय राजद्वारमुपागमत् ।।
data.md: Some days having passed in this wise-a villager, an old Brālimaņa, arrived at the palace gate with a dead boy.

data.v: रुदन्बहुविधा वाचः स्नेहाक्षरसमन्विताः । असकृत्पुत्र पुत्रेति वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
किं नु मे दुष्कृतं कर्म पूर्वं देहान्तरे कृतम् । यदहं पुत्रमेकं त्वां पश्यामि निधनं गतम् ।।
अप्राप्तयौवनं बालं पञ्चवर्षसमन्वितम् । अकाले कालमापन्नं दुःखाय मम पुत्रक ।।
अल्पैरहोभिर्निधनं गमिष्यामि न संशयः । अहं च जननी चैव तव शोकेन पुत्रक ।।
data.md: My son, you have not as yet completed fourteen years. To my misery you have met with untimely death. Forsooth, for your grief, O my son, myself and your mother shall soon be snatched away by death.

data.v: न स्मराम्यनृतं ह्युक्तं न च हिंसां स्मराम्यहम् । केन मे दुष्कृतेनाद्य बाल एव ममात्मजः । अकृत्वा पितृकार्याणि नीतो वैवस्वतक्षयम् ।।
data.md: I do not remember to have ever uttered a falsehood, or injured an animal or perpetrated any other crime. Therefore for some other sinful action, this boy, without performing the son's duties towards his parents, has gone to the abode of death.

data.v: नेदृशं दृष्टपूर्वं मे श्रुतं वा घोरदर्शनम् । मृत्युरप्राप्तकालानां रामस्य विषये यथा ।।
data.md: Save under the regime of Rama, I have never seen or heard of the dreadful death of such a boy who has not attained the age.

data.v: रामस्य दुष्कृतं किंचिन्महदस्ति न संशयः । त्वं राजञ्जीवयस्वैनं बालं मृत्युवशं गतम् ।।
data.md: Forsooth, Rāma has perpetrated a mighty iniquity for which boys, during his administration, have been meeting with untimely death.

data.v: भ्रातृभिः सहितो राजन्दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुहि । उषिताः स्म सुखं राज्ये तवास्मिन्सुमहाबल ।।
संप्रत्यनाथो विषय इक्ष्वाकूणां महात्मनाम् । रामं नाथमिहासाद्य बालान्तकरणं नृपम् ।।
राजदोषैर्विपद्यन्ते प्रजा ह्यविधिपालिताः । असद्वृत्ते तु नृपतावकाले म्रियते जनः ।।
यदा पुरेष्वयुक्तानि जना जनपदेषु च । कुर्वते न च रक्षास्ति तदाकालकृतं भयम् ।।
सुव्यक्तं राजदोषोऽयं भविष्यति न संशयः । पुरे जनपदे वापि तदा बालवधो ह्ययम् ।।
data.md: Evident it is therefore that undoubtedly the sin of the king has appeared in cities and provinces. And for that reason this boy has met with death.

data.v: एवं बहुविधैर्वाक्यैर्निन्दयानो मुहुर्मुहुः । राजानं दुःखसंतप्तः सुतं तमुपगूहति ।।
data.md: Being overwhelmed with sorrow that old Brāhmaṇa again and again remonstrated with the king in these 'piteous words and afterwards covered the dead body (of his son.)

data.v: तथा तु करुणं तस्य द्विजस्य परिदेवितम् । शुश्राव राघवः सर्वं दुःखशोकसमन्वितम् ।।
data.md: Hearing those sorrowful words of the Brāhmaṇa, Rāma was greatly sorry and sent for Vasistha, Vamadeva, his brothers, citizens and councillors.

data.v: स दुःखेन सुसंतप्तो मन्त्रिणः समुपाह्वयत् । वसिष्ठं वामदेवं च भ्रातॄंश्च सहनैगमान् ।।
data.md: Hearing those sorrowful words of the Brāhmaṇa, Rāma was greatly sorry and sent for Vasistha, Vamadeva, his brothers, citizens and councillors.

data.v: ततो द्विजा वसिष्ठेन सार्धमष्टौ प्रवेशिताः । राजानं देवसंकाशं वर्धस्वेति ततोऽब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: There upon having entered the apartment in the company of Vasiştha, eight Brāhmaṇas blessed the king Rāma, resembling a celestial, saying 'may victory crown you.'

data.v: मार्कण्डेयोऽथ मौद्गल्यो वामदेवश्च काश्यपः । कात्यायनोऽथ जाबालिर्गौतमो नारदस्तथा ।।
एते द्विजर्षभाः सर्वे आसनेषूपवेशिताः । मन्त्रिणो नैगमाश्चैव यथार्हमनुकूलतः ।।
ताषां समुपविष्टानां सर्वेषां दीप्ततेजसाम् । राघवः सर्वमाचष्टे द्विजो यस्मात्प्ररोदिति ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राज्ञो दीनस्य नारदः । प्रत्युवाच शुभं वाक्यमृषीणां संनिधौ नृपम् ।।
data.md: Hearing those words of the poorly king, Narada, in the presence of all other Rsis, replied.

data.v: शृणु राजन्यथाकाले प्राप्तोऽयं बालसंक्षयः । श्रुत्वा कर्तव्यतां वीर कुरुष्व रघुनन्दन ।।
data.md: Hear, o king, why this boy has met with untimely death. And hearing this, O descendant or Raghu, do you settle what you think proper.

data.v: पुरा कृतयुगे राम ब्राह्मणा वै तपस्विनः । अब्राह्मणस्तदा राजन्न तपस्वी कथंचन ।।
data.md: O king, in the golden age, only the Brahmanas used to engage in asceticism. At that age save the Brāhmaṇas no other caste used to lead the life of an anchoret.

data.v: तस्मिन्युगे प्रज्वलिते ब्रह्मभूते अनावृते । अमृत्यवस्तदा सर्वे जज्ञिरे दीर्घदर्शिनः ।।
data.md: And for this, the Brāhmaṇas were the highest caste, effulgent in asceticism, asceticism, shorn shorn of ignorance, above death and conversant with three ages.

data.v: ततस्त्रेतायुगं नाम मानवानां वपुष्मताम् । क्षत्रिया यत्र जायन्ते पूर्वेण तपसान्विताः ।।
data.md: There upon at the end of the golden age, Brāhmaṇa's understanding became loose and the Tretā Yuga set in. At this age Kşatriyas, gifted with the power acquired by pristine asceticism, were born. And those men, intent upon austere penances, that were born in the Tretā age, were more powerful and greater devotees than those in the former age.

data.v: वीर्येण तपसा चैव तेऽधिकाः पूर्वजन्मनि । मानवा ये महात्मानस्तस्मिंस्त्रेतायुगे युगे ।।
ब्रह्मक्षत्रं तु तत्सर्वं यत्पूर्वमपरं च यत् । युगयोरुभयोरासीत्समवीर्यसमन्वितम् ।।
data.md: In the golden age the Brāhmaṇas were more powerful than the Kșatriyas. But in the Tretā age the Brāhmaṇas and the Ksatriyas were equally powerful.

data.v: अपश्यन्तस्तु ते सर्वे विशेषमधिकं ततः । स्थापनं चक्रिरे तत्र चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य सर्वतः ।।
data.md: Thus in the Tretā age, not beholding prominence of the Brāhmaṇas greater than that of the Kşatriyas, Manu and other religious leaders of the time composed the Sastra describing and setting in the four divisions of castes.

data.v: अधर्मः पादमेकं तु पातयत्पृथिवीतले । अधर्मेण हि संयुक्तास्तेन मन्दाभवन्द्विजाः ।।
data.md: In this wise the Tretā age was prolific with virtues of the four Varņas, and many pious sacrifices and was shorn of iniquities. But being attacked a little with iniquity, one portion of sin appeared on earth. And growing impious people of sin appeared on earth. And growing impious people lost their strength.

data.v: ततः प्रादुष्कृतं पूर्वमायुषः परिनिष्ठितम् । शुभान्येवाचरँल्लोकाः सत्यधर्मपरायणाः ।।
त्रेतायुगे त्ववर्तन्त ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रियश्च ये । तपोऽतप्यन्त ते सर्वे शुश्रूषामपरे जनाः ।।
data.md: During the Tretă age the Brāhmaṇas and Kș atriyas engaged in austere penances and the Vaiśyas and Sūdras engaged in serving them.

data.v: स धर्मः परमस्तेषां वैश्यशूद्रमथागमत् । पूजां च सर्ववर्णानां शूद्राश्चक्रुर्विशेषतः ।।
data.md: And the greatest piety of the Vaiśyas and Śūdras at that time consisted of serving the Brāhmaṇas and Ksatriyas and specially for the Śūdras the highest religion was to serve people of all Varnas.

data.v: ततः पादमधर्मस्य द्वितीयमवतारयत् । ततो द्वापरसंख्या सा युगस्य समजायत ।।
data.md: And the second foot of impiety being ushered into the world the Dvāpara age set in.

data.v: तस्मिन्द्वापरसंख्ये तु वर्तमाने युगक्षये । अधर्मश्चानृतं चैव ववृधे पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, during this age two legs of piety being cut off, impiety and untruth multiplies.

data.v: तस्मिन्द्वापरसंख्याते तपो वैश्यान्समाविशत् । न शूद्रो लभते धर्ममुग्रं तप्तं नरर्षभ ।।
हीनवर्णो नरश्रेष्ठ तप्यते सुमहत्तपः । भविष्या शूद्रयोन्यां हि तपश्चर्या कलौ युगे ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, the degraded caste, the Śūdras, during your rege me, have engaged in austere penances. And in the Kali Yuga asceticism shall be established in the Sūdras.

data.v: अधर्मः परमो राम द्वापरे शूद्रधारितः । स वै विषयपर्यन्ते तव राजन्महातपाः । शूद्रस्तप्यति दुर्बुद्धिस्तेन बालवधो ह्ययम् ।।
data.md: O king, even in Davāpara, devout penances for Śūdras were considered as impiety, what to speak of the Tretāage. O king, one Śūdras, under the influence of vicious understanding, has begun devout penances within your kingdom. And for that reason this boy has met with death.

data.v: यो ह्यधर्ममकार्यं वा विषये पार्थिवस्य हि । करोति राजशार्दूल पुरे वा दुर्मतिर्नरः । क्षिप्रं हि नरकं याति स च राजा न संशयः ।।
data.md: Calamity sets in that kingdom where a vicious-minded person commits an iniquity and that vicious wight and the king forsooth speedily repair to hell.

data.v: स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल मार्गस्व विषयं स्वकम् । दुष्कृतं यत्र पश्येथास्तत्र यत्नं समाचर ।।
data.md: While the king is entitled to the sixth portion of everything why should he not fully protect his subjects? Therefore, O chief of men, do you bring all informations of your kingdom. And be then studious to repress vices wherever you shall find them.

data.v: एवं ते धर्मवृद्धिश्च नृणां चायुर्विवर्धनम् । भविष्यति नरश्रेष्ठ बालस्यास्य च जीवितम् ।।
data.md: And by that, O foremost of men, the piety of the subjects shall be increased, the lease of their life shall be prolonged and this boy shall regain his life.

data.v: नारदस्य तु तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वामृतमयं यथा । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे लक्ष्मणं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Hearing the sweet words of the celestial saint Nārada, Rāma was greatly delighted and addressing Lakşmaņa said.

data.v: गच्छ सौम्य द्विजश्रेष्ठं समाश्वासय लक्ष्मण । बालस्य च शरीरं तत्तैलद्रोण्यां निधापय ।।
गन्धैश्च परमोदारैस्तैलैश्च सुसुगन्धिभिः । यथा न क्षीयते बालस्तथा सौम्य विधीयताम् ।।
यथा शरीरे बालस्य गुप्तस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । विपत्तिः परिभेदो वा भवेन्न च तथा कुरु ।।
तथा संदिश्य काकुत्स्थो लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम् । मनसा पुष्पकं दध्यावागच्छेति महायशाः ।।
इङ्गितं स तु विज्ञाय पुष्पको हेमभूषितः । आजगाम मुहूर्तेन समीपं राघवस्य वै ।।
सोऽब्रवीत्प्रणतो भूत्वा अयमस्मि नराधिप । वश्यस्तव महाबाहो किंकरः समुपस्थितः ।।
भाषितं रुचिरं श्रुत्वा पुष्पकस्य नराधिपः । अभिवाद्य महर्षीस्तान्विमानं सोऽध्यरोहत ।।
data.md: Hearing the sweet words of Puşpaka the king Rāma saluted the great ascetics, ascended the car with his burning bow, quiver and dagger and left Bharata and Lakşmaņa in charge of the city.

data.v: धनुर्गृहीत्वा तूणीं च खड्गं च रुचिरप्रभम् । निक्षिप्य नगरे वीरौ सौमित्रिभरतावुभौ ।।
data.md: Hearing the sweet words of Puşpaka the king Rāma saluted the great ascetics, ascended the car with his burning bow, quiver and dagger and left Bharata and Lakşmaņa in charge of the city.

data.v: प्रायात्प्रतीचीं स मरून्विचिन्वंश्च समन्ततः । उत्तरामगमच्छ्रीमान्दिशं हिमवदावृतम् ।।
data.md: And searching that Śūdra devotee here and there Rāghava proceeded towards the west. And not beholding him there he went to the North bounded by the Himālayas.

data.v: अपश्यमानस्तत्रापि स्वल्पमप्यथ दुष्कृतम् । पूर्वामपि दिशं सर्वामथापश्यन्नराधिपः ।।
data.md: And even there he did not espy the Sūdra ascetic and even the smallest iniquity was not seen there. There upon returning from that quarter the king journeyed the whole of east.

data.v: दक्षिणां दिशमाक्रामत्ततो राजर्षिनन्दनः । शैवलस्योत्तरे पार्श्वे ददर्श सुमहत्सरः ।।
data.md: From the east Răghava proceeded towards the south and espied a big tank by the side of the Saivala mountain.

data.v: तस्मिन्सरसि तप्यन्तं तापसं सुमहत्तपः । ददर्श राघवः श्रीमाँल्लम्बमानमधोमुखम् ।।
अथैनं समुपागम्य तप्यन्तं तप उत्तमम् । उवाच राघवो वाक्यं धन्यस्त्वमसि सुव्रत ।।
कस्यां योन्यां तपोवृद्ध वर्तसे दृढविक्रम । कौतूहलात्त्वां पृच्छामि रामो दाशरथिर्ह्यहम् ।।
मनीषितस्ते को न्वर्थः स्वर्गलाभो वराश्रयः । यमश्रित्य तपस्तप्तं श्रोतुमिच्छामि तापस ।।
ब्राह्मणो वासि भद्रं ते क्षत्रियो वासि दुर्जयः । वैश्यो वा यदि वा शूद्रः सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीहि मे ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । अवाक्शिरास्तथाभूतो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Hearing those words of Rāghva, the exceedingly energetic Kumbhayoni spoke as follows.

data.v: शूद्रयोन्यां प्रसूतोऽस्मि तप उग्रं समास्थितः । देवत्वं प्रार्थये राम सशरीरो महायशः ।।
data.md: O highly illustrious Rāma, I am born in the race of sūdras; and with a view to reach the region of the celestials with my body I am going through these austere penances.

data.v: न मिथ्याहं वदे राजन्देवलोकजिगीषया । शूद्रं मां विद्धि काकुत्स्थ शम्बूकं नाम नामतः ।।
data.md: O Kākutstha, I shall never utter a falsehood since I am willing to conquer the region of gods. I am a Sūdra and my name is Sambūka.

data.v: भाषतस्तस्य शूद्रस्य खड्गं सुरुचिरप्रभम् । निष्कृष्य कोशाद्विमलं शिरश्चिच्छेद राघवः ।।
data.md: The Sūdra ascetic having said this, Rama took out of scabbard a beautiful sharp sword and chopped off his head therewith.

data.v: तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते बालोऽसौ जीवेन समयुज्यत ।।
ततोऽगस्त्याश्रमपदं रामः कमललोचनः । स गत्वा विनयेनैव तं नत्वा मुमुदे सुखी ।।
सोऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं ज्वलन्तमिव तेजसा । आतिथ्यं परमं प्राप्य निषसाद नराधिपः ।।
data.md: Rāma saluted that high-souled and highly effulgent Rșis Agastya. And having received due hospitality he sat there.

data.v: तमुवाच महातेजाः कुम्भयोनिर्महातपाः । स्वागतं ते नरश्रेष्ठ दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि राघव ।।
data.md: Thereupon the highly effulgent and leading ascetic Kumbhayoni said: O Rāghava, I have been greatly delighted with your coming, By my good fortune I have seen the today.

data.v: त्वं मे बहुमतो राम गुणैर्बहुभिरुत्तमैः । अतिथिः पूजनीयश्च मम राजन्हृदि स्थितः ।।
data.md: O Rāma, I love you because you are gifted with many qualities. O king, you are my worshipful guest. I was thinking of you.

data.v: सुरा हि कथयन्ति त्वामागतं शूद्रघातिनम् । ब्राह्मणस्य तु धर्मेण त्वया जीवापितः सुतः ।।
data.md: The celestials informed me that you went coming having slain the Sūdra ascetic. You have observed piety and have given back life to dead child of the Brahmana.

data.v: उष्यतां चेह रजनीं सकाशे मम राघव । प्रभाते पुष्पकेण त्वं गन्ता स्वपुरमेव हि ।।
इदं चाभरणं सौम्य निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा । दिव्यं दिव्येन वपुषा दीप्यमानं स्वतेजसा । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व काकुत्स्थ मत्प्रियं कुरु राघव ।।
data.md: This ornament, O gentle one, has been made by the architect of the celestials; its make is very beautiful and it is dazzling by its own lustre.

data.v: दत्तस्य हि पुनर्दानं सुमहत्फलमुच्यते । तस्मात्प्रदास्ये विधिवत्तत्प्रतीच्छ नरर्षभ ।।
तद्रामः प्रतिजग्राह मुनेस्तस्य महात्मनः । दिव्यमाभरणं चित्रं प्रदीप्तमिव भास्करम् ।।
प्रतिगृह्य ततो रामस्तदाभरणमुत्तमम् । आगमं तस्य दिव्यस्य प्रष्टुमेवोपचक्रमे ।।
अत्यद्भुतमिदं ब्रह्मन्वपुषा युक्तमुत्तमम् । कथं भगवता प्राप्तं कुतो वा केन वाहृतम् ।।
कुतूहलतया ब्रह्मन्पृच्छामि त्वां महायशः । आश्चर्याणां बहूनां हि निधिः परमको भवान् ।।
data.md: When have you obtained this celestial ornamens of a wondrous make? Who have given you this? O Brāhmaṇa, I do accost you thus out of curiosity. You are the mine of many wonders.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे मुनिर्वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् । शृणु राम यथावृत्तं पुरा त्रेतायुगे गते ।।
data.md: Whereto Agastya replied, saying Hearken, O Rāma, how I did obtain this ornament in the Tretă age.

data.v: पुरा त्रेतायुगे ह्यासीदरण्यं बहुविस्तरम् । समन्ताद्योजनशतं निर्मृगं पक्षिवर्जितम् ।।
data.md: O Răma, in Tretāage, there was a huge forest extending over hundred Yojanas divested of animals and men.

data.v: तस्मिन्निर्मानुषेऽरण्ये कुर्वाणस्तप उत्तमम् । अहमाक्रमितुं सौम्य तदरण्यमुपागमम् ।।
data.md: In that forest of without men I used to perform my austere penances. Once on a time I began to roam all over the forest being willing to see well every nook and corner of it. And I saw that it was impossible to ascertain how very pleasant that forest was. In every place there were trees with profuse sweet fruits. and roots.

data.v: तस्य रूपमरण्यस्य निर्देष्टुं न शशाक ह । फलमूलैः सुखास्वादैर्बहुरूपैश्च पादपैः ।।
data.md: In that forest of without men I used to perform my austere penances. Once on a time I began to roam all over the forest being willing to see well every nook and corner of it. And I saw that it was impossible to ascertain how very pleasant that forest was. In every place there were trees with profuse sweet fruits. and roots.

data.v: तस्यारण्यस्य मध्ये तु सरो योजनमायतम् । पद्मोत्पलसमाकीर्णं समतिक्रान्तशैवलम् ।।
तदाश्चर्यमिवात्यर्थं सुखास्वादमनुत्तमम् । अरजस्कं तथाक्षोभ्यं श्रीमत्पक्षिगणायुतम् ।।
तस्मिन्सरःसमीपे तु महदद्भुतमाश्रमम् । पुराणं पुण्यमत्यर्थं तपस्विजनवर्जितम् ।।
तत्राहमवसं रात्रिं नैदाघीं पुरुषर्षभ । प्रभाते काल्यमुत्थाय सरस्तदुपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: O best among the men, it was summer and I spent that night in that hermitage. Next morning leaving my bed I arrived at the banks of the pond and saw a plump dead body in the waters. None of its limbs was pale and its beauty was not spoiled.

data.v: अथापश्यं शवं तत्र सुपुष्टमजरं क्वचित् । तिष्ठन्तं परया लक्ष्म्या तस्मिंस्तोयाशये नृप ।।
data.md: O best among the men, it was summer and I spent that night in that hermitage. Next morning leaving my bed I arrived at the banks of the pond and saw a plump dead body in the waters. None of its limbs was pale and its beauty was not spoiled.

data.v: तमर्थं चिन्तयानोऽहं मुहूर्तं तत्र राघव । विष्ठितोऽस्मि सरस्तीरे किं न्विदं स्यादिति प्रभो ।।
अथापश्यं मुहूर्तात्तु दिव्यमद्भुतदर्शनम् । विमानं परमोदारं हंसयुक्तं मनोजवम् ।।
अत्यर्थं स्वर्गिणं तत्र विमाने रघुनन्दन । उपास्तेऽप्सरसां वीर सहस्रं दिव्यभूषणम् । गान्ति गेयानि रम्याणि वादयन्ति तथापराः ।।
पश्यतो मे तदा राम विमानादवरुह्य च । तं शवं भक्षयामास स स्वर्गी रघुनन्दन ।।
data.md: O Rāma, the foremost of Raghu's race, like to the moon renouncing the summit of the Sumeru mount that celestial wight got down from his seat in the car and engaged in devouring the dead body.

data.v: ततो भुक्त्वा यथाकामं मांसं बहु च सुष्ठु च । अवतीर्य सरः स्वर्गी संस्प्रष्टुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: And having taken enough flesh he got down into waters and duly performed ablution. O Rāma, there after that heavenly being again addressed himself for ascending the car.

data.v: उपस्पृश्य यथान्यायं स स्वर्गी पुरुषर्षभ । आरोढुमुपचक्राम विमानवरमुत्तमम् ।।
तमहं देवसंकाशमारोहन्तमुदीक्ष्य वै । अथाहमब्रुवं वाक्यं तमेव पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, beholding that heavenly being about to get up I accosted him, saying, Who are you? I see, you have a celestial firm, then why have you taken such an abominable food?

data.v: को भवान्देवसंकाश आहारश्च विगर्हितः । त्वयायं भुज्यते सौम्य किं कर्थं वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, beholding that heavenly being about to get up I accosted him, saying, Who are you? I see, you have a celestial firm, then why have you taken such an abominable food?

data.v: आश्चर्यमीदृशो भावो भास्वरो देवसंमतः । आहारो गर्हितः सौम्य श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ।।
भुक्त्वा तु भाषितं वाक्यं मम राम शुभाक्षरम् । प्राञ्जलिः प्रत्युवाचेदं स स्वर्गी रघुनन्दन ।।
data.md: O Rāma, hearing my words pregnant with sound reasoning, that heavenly being, with folded hands, said.

data.v: शृणु ब्रह्मन्यथावृत्तं ममैतत्सुखदुःखयोः । दुरतिक्रमणीयं हि यथा पृच्छसि मां द्विज ।।
data.md: Hear, O Brāhmaṇa, from what unavoidable cause has proceeded this happy and again painful incident.

data.v: पुरा वैदर्भको राजा पिता मम महायशाः । सुदेव इति विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: There flourished in the days of yore a highly illustratious and powerful Vidarbha king under the name of Sudeva known over three worlds. He was my father.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रद्वयं ब्रह्मन्द्वाभ्यां स्त्रीभ्यामजायत । अहं श्वेत इति ख्यातो यवीयान्सुरथोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: His two queens gave birth to two sons. My name is Sveta and the name of my youngest brother was Suratha.

data.v: ततः पितरि स्वर्याते पौरा मामभ्यषेचयन् । तत्राहं कृतवान्राज्यं धर्मेण सुसमाहितः ।।
data.md: After the decease of my sire the subjects installed me on the throne and I governed them piously and carefully for a thousand years.

data.v: एवं वर्षसहस्राणि समतीतानि सुव्रत । राज्यं कारयतो ब्रह्मन्प्रजा धर्मेण रक्षतः ।।
data.md: After the decease of my sire the subjects installed me on the throne and I governed them piously and carefully for a thousand years.

data.v: सोऽहं निमित्ते कस्मिंश्चिद्विज्ञातायुर्द्विजोत्तम । कालधर्मं हृदि न्यस्य ततो वनमुपागमम् ।।
data.md: By some reason I was informed of the extent of my life. And when I perceived that the lease of my life had well-night expired I entered into the life of Vānaprastha.

data.v: सोऽहं वनमिदं दुर्गं मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम् । तपश्चर्तुं प्रविष्टोऽस्मि समीपे सरसः शुभे ।।
data.md: And having placed my brother Suratha on the throne I entered into a dense forest devoid of men and animals at no distance from this pond to perform devout penances. And I performed austerities for a long time near this pond.

data.v: भ्रातरं सुरथं राज्ये अभिषिच्य नराधिपम् । इदं सरः समासाद्य तपस्तप्तं मया चिरम् ।।
सोऽहं वर्षसहस्राणि तपस्त्रीणि महामुने । तप्त्वा सुदुष्करं प्राप्तो ब्रह्मलोकमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Having performed hard penances in this forest, for three thousand years I at last attained to the region of Brahmā.

data.v: ततो मां स्वर्गसंस्थं वै क्षुत्पिपासे द्विजोत्तम । बाधेते परमोदार ततोऽहं व्यथितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.md: And albeit I had reached the Brahmā region I was still being assailed by hunger and thirst. And gradually I grew tired therewith.

data.v: गत्वा त्रिभुवणश्रेष्ठं पितामहमुवाच ह । भगवन्ब्रह्मलोकोऽयं क्षुत्पिपासाविवर्जितः ।।
data.md: There upon approaching the patriarch Brahma, the lord of three worlds, I said: O lord, here there is no hunger or thirst; still why have I been brought to their control? Of what iniquity of mine is this fruit? O deity, tell me upon what I shall live.

data.v: कस्येयं कर्मणः प्राप्तिः क्षुत्पिपासावशोऽस्मि यत् । आहारः कश्च मे देव तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ।।
पितामहस्तु मामाह तवाहारः सुदेवज । स्वादूनि स्वानि मांसानि तानि भक्षय नित्यशः ।।
data.md: Whereto the patriarch replied: O son of Sudeva, do you live upon sweet savoured meat everyday.

data.v: स्वशरीरं त्वया पुष्टं कुर्वता तप उत्तमम् । अनुप्तं रोहते श्वेत न कदाचिन्महामते ।।
data.md: O Śveta, you did only look to the growth of your person when you did perform rigid penances. O you of a great mind, nothing grows, when nothing is sown. You did only perform ascetic penances, but you did not make any gift of charity. It is for that reason, O my son, that you are, even in heaven, being assailed by hunger and thirst.

data.v: दत्तं न तेऽस्ति सूक्ष्मोऽपि वने सत्त्वनिषेविते । तेन स्वर्गगतो वत्स बाध्यसे क्षुत्पिपासया ।।
data.md: O Śveta, you did only look to the growth of your person when you did perform rigid penances. O you of a great mind, nothing grows, when nothing is sown. You did only perform ascetic penances, but you did not make any gift of charity. It is for that reason, O my son, that you are, even in heaven, being assailed by hunger and thirst.

data.v: स त्वं सुपुष्टमाहारैः स्वशरीरमनुत्तमम् । भक्षयस्वामृतरसं सा ते तृप्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Thereupon do you now live upon your own dead body fostered by various food. By this you shall keep up your being.

data.v: यदा तु तद्वनं श्वेत अगस्त्यः सुमहानृषिः । आक्रमिष्यति दुर्धर्षस्तदा कृच्छाद्विमोक्ष्यसे ।।
data.md: O Sveta, you shall be relived from this affliction when the irrepressible, great Saint Agastya shall reach that forest.

data.v: स हि तारयितुं सौम्य शक्तः सुरगणानपि । किं पुनस्त्वां महाबाहो क्षुत्पिपासावशं गतम् ।।
data.md: O gentle one, even to the immortals he can give salvation; what wonder it is that he shall relieve you from the miseries of hunger and thirst.

data.v: सोऽहं भगवतः श्रुत्वा देवदेवस्य निश्चयम् । आहारं गर्हितं कुर्मि स्वशरीरं द्विजोत्तम ।।
data.md: O foremost of twice-born ones, from the time of hearing those words of the great Brahma, the god of gods, I have been engaged in this cursed work of feeding upon my own dead body.

data.v: बहून्वर्षगणान्ब्रह्मन्भुज्यमानमिदं मया । क्षयं नाभ्येति ब्रह्मर्षे तृप्तिश्चापि ममोत्तमा ।।
data.md: O Brāhmaṇa, for many long years I have been living upon this corpse still I have not done with it. O Saint, I, too, derive satisfaction from it; I now understand that you are the illustrious Agastya born of a Kumbha; for none else is capable of coming here; do you therefore save me from this pain, who am afflicted with great miseries.

data.v: तस्य मे कृच्छ्रभूतस्य कृच्छ्रादस्माद्विमोक्षय । अन्येषामगतिर्ह्यत्र कुम्भयोनिमृते द्विजम् ।।
इदमाभरणं सौम्य तारणार्थं द्विजोत्तम । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व ब्रह्मर्षे प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: O foremost of twice-born ones, O gentle one, do you take this ornament; may good betide you. Do you be propitiated with me.

data.v: तस्याहं स्वर्गिणो वाक्यं श्रुत्वा दुःखसमन्वितम् । तारणायोपजग्राह तदाभरणमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Hearing those words of the heavenly being, exciting pity, I accepted this ornament for saving him.

data.v: मया प्रतिगृहीते तु तस्मिन्नाभरणे शुभे । मानुषः पूर्वको देहो राजर्षेः स ननाश ह ।।
data.md: And as soon as I took this ornament that human body of the royal saint disappeared.

data.v: प्रनष्टे तु शरीरेऽसौ राजर्षिः परया मुदा । तृप्तः प्रमुदितो राजा जगाम त्रिदिवं पुनः ।।
data.md: And the body being dissolved, the royal saint Śveta, greatly delighted, happily went to the land of immortals.

data.v: तेनेदं शक्रतुल्येन दिव्यमाभरणं मम । तस्मिन्निमित्ते काकुत्स्थ दत्तमद्भुतदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: It is for this reason, O Kākutstha, that royal saint, resembling Indra, conferred upon me this wondrous, celestial ornament.

data.v: तदद्भुततमं वाक्यं श्रुत्वागस्त्यस्य राघवः । गौरवाद्विस्मयाच्चैव भूयः प्रष्टुं प्रचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Hearing the wondrous words of the great saint Kumbhayoni, Rāma, out of great curiosity and importance of the subject, again asked him, saying.

data.v: भगवंस्तद्वनं घोरं तपस्तप्यति यत्र सः । श्वेतो वैदर्भको राजा कथं तदमृगद्विजम् ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, why was that dense forest, in which the king Sveta of Vidarbha used to perform hard penances, divested of birds and animals?

data.v: निःसत्त्वं च वनं जातं शून्यं मनुजवर्जितम् । तपश्चर्तुं प्रविष्टः स श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.md: And how did he proceed to that forest devoid of men and animals for undergoing penances? I wish to hear the truth.

data.v: रामस्य भाषितं श्रुत्वा कौतूहलसमन्वितम् । वाक्यं परमतेजस्वी वक्तुमेवोपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of Rāma stricken with curiosity, the highly effulgent saint Agastya said.

data.v: पुरा कृतयुगे राम मनुर्दण्डधरः प्रभुः । तस्य पुत्रो महानासीदिक्ष्वाकुः कुलवर्धनः ।।
data.md: O Rāma, formerly in the golden age, Manu was the king. His son was ikṣvāku.

data.v: तं पुत्रं पूर्वके राज्ये निक्षिप्य भुवि दुर्जयम् । पृथिव्यां राजवंशानां भव कर्तेत्युवाच ह ।।
data.md: Ha. ing instaned the irrepressible Iksvāku, Manu said: 'By you the lord over creatures.' Saying so be it Ikşvāku accepted the command. There upon greatly delighted Manu said to his son.

data.v: तथेति च प्रतिज्ञातं पितुः पुत्रेण राघव । ततः परमसंहृष्टो मनुः पुनरुवाच ह ।।
प्रीतोऽस्मि परमोदारकर्ता चासि न संशयः । दण्डेन च प्रजा रक्ष मा च दण्डमकारणे ।।
data.md: I have been highly pleased with you. For sooth you shall become a very liberal price. You shall govern the subjects meting out proper punishment to them, but do not punish them without any fault.

data.v: अपराधिषु यो दण्डः पात्यते मानवेषु वै । स दण्डो विधिवन्मुक्तः स्वर्गं नयति पार्थिवम् ।।
data.md: If the punishment, which a king inflicts upon the guilty, be just it becomes the instrumental in taking the giver to heaven.

data.v: तस्माद्दण्डे महाबाहो यत्नवान्भव पुत्रक । धर्मो हि परमो लोके कुर्वतस्ते भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Therefore, O my son having large arms, be particularly studious as regards punishment for thereby you shall acquire great piety.

data.v: इति तं बहु संदिश्य मनुः पुत्रं समाधिना । जगाम त्रिदिवं हृष्टो ब्रह्मलोकमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Having in this wise advised Ikşvāku Manu delightedly repaired to the region Brahmā.

data.v: प्रयाते त्रिदिवे तस्मिन्निक्ष्वाकुरमितप्रभः । जनयिष्ये कथं पुत्रानिति चिन्तापरोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: After Manu's departure towards the heaven, the effulgent Ikşavku thought of the means for creating progeny.

data.v: कर्मभिर्बहुरूपैश्च तैस्तैर्मनुसुतः सुतान् । जनयामास धर्मात्मा शतं देवसुतोपमान् ।।
data.md: Thereupon performing many pious rites Manu's son engendered a hundred sons. O descendant of Raghu, the youngest of all those sons became stupid and ignorant and did not respect his elder brothers.

data.v: तेषामवरजस्तात सर्वेषां रघुनन्दन । मूढश्चाकृतिविद्यश्च न शुश्रूषति पूर्वजान् ।।
data.md: Thereupon performing many pious rites Manu's son engendered a hundred sons. O descendant of Raghu, the youngest of all those sons became stupid and ignorant and did not respect his elder brothers.

data.v: नाम तस्य च दण्डेति पिता चक्रेऽल्पतेजसः । अवश्यं दण्डपतनं शरीरेऽस्य भविष्यति ।।
data.md: And thinking that he should therefore be punished he named this son 'Danda.'

data.v: स पश्यमानस्तं दोषं घोरं पुत्रस्य राघव । विन्ध्यशैवलयोर्मध्ये राज्यं प्रादादरिंदम ।।
data.md: Thereupon finding no other province worthy of Danda he allotted the region between Vihdhya and Saivala to him.

data.v: स दण्डस्तत्र राजाभूद्रम्ये पर्वतरोधसि । पुरं चाप्रतिमं राम न्यवेशयदनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Danda became king of that picturesque valley. And having reared a fine city there he named it as Madhumanta and appointed śukrācārya of firm views as his priest.

data.v: पुरस्य चाकरोन्नाम मधुमन्तमिति प्रभो । पुरोहितं चोशनसं वरयामास सुव्रतम् ।।
data.md: Danda became king of that picturesque valley. And having reared a fine city there he named it as Madhumanta and appointed śukrācārya of firm views as his priest.

data.v: एवं स राजा तद्राज्यं कारयत्सपुरोहितः । प्रहृष्टमनुजाकीर्णं देवराज्यं यथा दिवि ।।
data.md: Having thus established his kingdom, Danda, with his priest, began to lord over it filled with healthy and delighted people like to the lord of celestials in their region.

data.v: एतदाख्याय रामाय महर्षिः कुम्भसंभवः । अस्यामेवापरं वाक्यं कथायामुपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Having related this story to Rāma the great saint Agastya again said in this context.

data.v: ततः स दण्डः काकुत्स्थ बहुवर्षगणायुतम् । अकरोत्तत्र मन्दात्मा राज्यं निहतकण्टकम् ।।
data.md: O Kākutstha, having subdued his passions, the king Danda, reigned undisturbed in this wise for many long years.

data.v: अथ काले तु कस्मिंश्चिद्राजा भार्गवमाश्रमम् । रमणीयमुपाक्रामच्चैत्रे मासि मनोरमे ।।
data.md: Thereupon during spring, in the month of Caitra the king arrived at the picturesque hermitage of the preceptor Sukra.

data.v: तत्र भार्गवकन्यां स रूपेणाप्रतिमां भुवि । विचरन्तीं वनोद्देशे दण्डोऽपश्यदनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.md: At that time, Sukra's daughter, matchless in beauty and grace, was walking in the forest. The king saw that jewel of a girl, and being stricken with lust and growing restless he approached her and said.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा तां सुदुर्मेधा अनङ्गशरपीडितः । अभिगम्य सुसंविग्नः कन्यां वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: At that time, Sukra's daughter, matchless in beauty and grace, was walking in the forest. The king saw that jewel of a girl, and being stricken with lust and growing restless he approached her and said.

data.v: कुतस्त्वमसि सुश्रोणि कस्य वासि सुता शुभे । पीडितोऽहमनङ्गेन पृच्छामि त्वां सुमध्यमे ।।
data.md: O you having a beautiful waist, O fair lady, whose daughter are you? O you having a moonlike countenance, I have been assailed by the arrows of Cupid and hence I do accost you thus.

data.v: तस्य त्वेवं ब्रुवाणस्य मोहोन्मत्तस्य कामिनः । भार्गवी प्रत्युवाचेदं वचः सानुनयं नृपम् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the vicious-souled Danda, maddened with lust, Sukra's daughter humbly said.

data.v: भार्गवस्य सुतां विद्धि देवस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । अरजां नाम राजेन्द्र ज्येष्ठामाश्रमवासिनीम् ।।
data.md: "O king of kings I am the daughter of the humbly Sukra of unwearied actions and my name is Araja. I am living in this hermitage, O king, do not touch me forcibly for I am a maid and hence under the guardianship forcibly for my father. Besides my father is my preceptor, and you are also his disciple.

data.v: गुरुः पिता मे राजेन्द्र त्वं च शिष्यो महात्मनः । व्यसनं सुमहत्क्रुद्धः स ते दद्यान्महातपाः ।।
यदि वात्र मया कार्यं धर्मदृष्टेन सत्पथा । वरयस्व नृप श्रेष्ठ पितरं मे महाद्युतिम् ।।
अन्यथा तु फलं तुभ्यं भवेद्घोराभिसंहितम् । क्रोधेन हि पिता मेऽसौ त्रैलोक्यमपि निर्दहेत् ।।
एवं ब्रुवाणामरजां दण्डः कामशरार्दितः । प्रत्युवाच मदोन्मत्तः शिरस्याधाय सोऽञ्जलिम् ।।
data.md: Arajas having said this, the king Danda, maddened with lust, placing folded palms on his head, said.

data.v: प्रसादं कुरु सुश्रोणि न कालं क्षेप्तुमर्हसि । त्वत्कृते हि मम प्राणा विदीर्यन्ते शुभानने ।।
data.md: Be you propitiated with me, O you having a graceful person; do not tarry even for a moment. My heart bursts out for you, O you having a moon-like countenance. For acquiring you I can even take upon myself my own destruction or dreadful iniquity. Do you seek me, O fair ladyI am beside myself for you.

data.v: त्वां प्राप्य हि वधो वापि पापं वापि सुदारुणम् । भक्तं भजस्व मां भीरु भजमानं सुविह्वलम् ।।
data.md: Be you propitiated with me, O you having a graceful person; do not tarry even for a moment. My heart bursts out for you, O you having a moon-like countenance. For acquiring you I can even take upon myself my own destruction or dreadful iniquity. Do you seek me, O fair ladyI am beside myself for you.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु तां कन्यां दोर्भ्यां गृह्य बलाद्बली । विस्फुरन्तीं यथाकामं मैथुनायोपचक्रमे ।।
data.md: Having said this the king forcibly ravished her. Having perpetrated such a mighty iniquity he speedily returned to his own city Madhumanta.

data.v: तमनर्थं महाघोरं दण्डः कृत्वा सुदारुणम् । नगरं प्रययौ चाशु मधुमन्तमनुत्तमम् ।।
अरजापि रुदन्ती सा आश्रमस्याविदूरतः । प्रतीक्षते सुसंत्रस्ता पितरं देवसंनिभम् ।।
data.md: Arajă cried aloud in forest at no distance from the hermitage and waited for here sire who had been away on visiting the celestials.

data.v: स मुहूर्तादुपश्रुत्य देवर्षिरमितप्रभः । स्वमाश्रमं शिष्य वृतः क्षुधार्तः संन्यवर्तत ।।
data.md: Thereupon having heard everything about Arajă from a disciple, he, surrounded by his pupils, arrived at his own hermitage and beheld her there poorly, soiled with dust and like to the morning rays of the moon possessed by a planet.

data.v: सोऽपश्यदरजां दीनां रजसा समभिप्लुताम् । ज्योत्स्नामिवारुणग्रस्तां प्रत्यूषे न विराजतीम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having heard everything about Arajă from a disciple, he, surrounded by his pupils, arrived at his own hermitage and beheld her there poorly, soiled with dust and like to the morning rays of the moon possessed by a planet.

data.v: तस्य रोषः समभवत्क्षुधार्तस्य विशेषतः । निर्दहन्निव लोकांस्त्रीञ्शिष्यांश्चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: He was stricken with hunger and was greatly incensed on beholding his daughter in that wretched plight, as if burning the three worlds with rage. Addressing his pupils, he said.

data.v: पश्यध्वं विपरीतस्य दण्डस्याविदितात्मनः । विपत्तिं घोरसंकाशां क्रुद्धामग्निशिखामिव ।।
data.md: Do you witness today the dreadful calamity, arising out of my flaming ire, of the vicious Daņda treading the path of immorality.

data.v: क्षयोऽस्य दुर्मतेः प्राप्तः सानुगस्य दुरात्मनः । यः प्रदीप्तां हुताशस्य शिखां वै स्प्रष्टुमिच्छति ।।
data.md: This vicious wight has placed his hands in the burning flame so he shall, along with followers, meet with destruction.

data.v: यस्मात्स कृतवान्पापमीदृशं घोरदर्शनम् । तस्मात्प्राप्स्यति दुर्मेधाः फलं पापस्य कर्मणः ।।
data.md: Since that vile being has perpetrated such a dreadful crime he shall forsooth suffer the consequence thereof.

data.v: सप्तरात्रेण राजासौ सभृत्यबलवाहनः । पापकर्मसमाचारो वधं प्राप्स्यति दुर्मतिः ।।
data.md: Within seven nights, the wicked and vicious Daņda, with his son, soldiers and retinue, shall meet with death.

data.v: समन्ताद्योजनशतं विषयं चास्य दुर्मतेः । धक्ष्यते पांसुवर्षेण महता पाकशासनः ।।
data.md: Showering dust Indra shall destroy, to the extent of a hundred Yojana, the territory of this vicious king.

data.v: सर्वसत्त्वानि यानीह स्थावराणि चराणि च । महता पांसुवर्षेण नाशं यास्यन्ति सर्वशः ।।
data.md: And all creatures mobile and immobile, wherever they might be, shall be destroyed with this downpour of dust.

data.v: दण्डस्य विषयो यावत्तावत्सर्वसमुच्छ्रयः । पांसुभुत इवालक्ष्यः सप्तरात्राद्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: All animals as far as this Daņdas' territory extends, shall be destroyed within seven nights.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा क्रोधसंतपस्तमाश्रमनिवासिनम् । जनं जनपदान्तेषु स्थीयतामिति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Having said this, with eyes reddened with ire, USanas, Bhrgu's son, said to the inmates of his hermitage: Do you all go and wait outside this kingdom.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तूशसनो वाक्यं स आश्रमावसथो जनः । निष्क्रान्तो विषयात्तस्य स्थानं चक्रेऽथ बाह्यतः ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the preceptor Sukra, the inmates left the hermitage and lived at a place beyond the limit of Danda's territories.

data.v: स तथोक्त्वा मुनिजनमरजामिदमब्रवीत् । इहैव वस दुर्मेधे आश्रमे सुसमाहिता ।।
data.md: Having thus addressed the inmates of the hermitage the great saint, said to Arajās. O unfortunate girl, with a devoted mind do you wait at this hermitage.

data.v: इदं योजनपर्यन्तं सरः सुरुचिरप्रभम् । अरजे विज्वरा भुङ्क्ष्व कालश्चात्र प्रतीक्ष्यताम् ।।
data.md: Without any anxiety O Arajās, do you wait for the time at the picturesque banks of this pond extending over a Yojana.

data.v: त्वत्समीपे तु ये सत्त्वा वासमेष्यन्ति तां निशाम् । अवध्याः पांसुवर्षेण ते भविष्यन्ति नित्यदा ।।
data.md: Within seven nights whoever shall approach you, shall be destroyed with this downpour of dust.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा भार्गवो वासमन्यत्र समुपाक्रमत् । सप्ताहाद्भस्मसाद्भूतं यथोक्तं ब्रह्मवादिना ।।
data.md: There upon Sukrācārya went away and lived elsewhere. According to the words of the saint, the entire kingdom of Danda, with servants, army, and conveyances, was destroyed within seven nights.

data.v: तस्यासौ दण्डविषयो विन्ध्यशैवलसानुषु । शप्तो ब्रह्मर्षिणा तेन पुरा वैधर्मके कृते ।।
data.md: O Rāma, in the golden age, the province between the mountains Vindhya and Saivala comprising Danda's territories, imprecated by the Brāhmaṇa saint, in consequence of the iniquity of the vicious souled, was reduced into a desert. From that time it passes by the name of Dandaka forest.

data.v: ततः प्रभृति काकुत्स्थ दण्डकारण्यमुच्यते । तपस्विनः स्थिता यत्र जनस्थानमथोऽभवत् ।।
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यन्मां पृच्छसि राघव । संध्यामुपासितुं वीर समयो ह्यतिवर्तते ।।
एते महर्षयः सर्वे पूर्णकुम्भाः समन्ततः । कृतोदको नरव्याघ्र आदित्यं पर्युपासते ।।
स तैरृषिभिरभ्यस्तः सहितैर्ब्रह्मसत्तमैः । रविरस्तं गतो राम गच्छोदकमुपस्पृश ।।
data.md: Having accepted adoration in the shape of Vedic hymns chanted by Brāhmaṇas, wellversed in Vedas, the illustrious Aditya is about to be set. Therefore, O Rāma, do you perform the ceremony.

data.v: ऋषेर्वचनमाज्ञाय रामः संध्यामुपासितुम् । उपाक्रामत्सरः पुण्यमप्सरोभिर्निषेवितम् ।।
तत्रोदकमुपस्पृश्य संध्यामन्वास्य पश्चिमाम् । आश्रमं प्राविशद्रामः कुम्भयोनेर्महात्मनः ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the great saint, Rāma, to perform the evening adoration, went to the pond filled with Apsarās; and having performed the worship he again returned to the hermitage of the high-souled Agastya.

data.v: अस्यागस्त्यो बहुगुणं फलमूलं तथौषधीः । शाकानि च पवित्राणि भोजनार्थमकल्पयत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon the great ascetic offered him food many substantial Kanda, roots, Osadhis and the holy Sali rice.

data.v: स भुक्तवान्नरश्रेष्ठस्तदन्नममृतोपमम् । प्रीतश्च परितुष्टश्च तां रात्रिं समुपावसत् ।।
data.md: And taking that nectar-like cooked rice, Rāma, the foremost of men, was greatly delighted and spent the night there.

data.v: प्रभाते काल्यमुत्थाय कृत्वाह्निकमरिंदमः । ऋषिं समभिचक्राम गमनाय रघूत्तमः ।।
अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्रामो महर्षिं कुम्भसंभवम् । आपृच्छे त्वां गमिष्यामि मामनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: Having got up in the morning and performed the necessary ceremonies he approached the ascetic to bid farewell, and saluting him said: O great Rșis, I do crave for your permission to go to my own habitation. Do you permit me.

data.v: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि दर्शनेन महात्मनः । द्रष्टुं चैवागमिष्यामि पावनार्थमिहात्मनः ।।
data.md: O high-souled one, I have been highly favoured and blessed by beholding you. I shall come again some other time to free myself from sins.

data.v: तथा वदति काकुत्स्थे वाक्यमद्भुतदर्शनम् । उवाच परमप्रीतो धर्मनेत्रस्तपोधनः ।।
data.md: Hearing those wondrous words of Rāma, Agastya having asceticism for his wealth, delightedly said.

data.v: अत्यद्भुतमिदं वाक्यं तव राम शुभाक्षरम् । पावनः सर्वलोकानां त्वमेव रघुनन्दन ।।
data.md: O Rāma these words, set in charming letters, are highly wonderful. O descendant of Raghu, you are the purifier of all creatures.

data.v: मुहूर्तमपि राम त्वां ये नु पश्यन्ति केचन । पाविताः स्वर्गभूतास्ते पूज्यन्ते दिवि दैवतैः ।।
data.md: O Rāma, one, who beholds you, even for a moment, becomes pure and worthy of repairing to heaven. Even the leading deities worship him.

data.v: ये च त्वां घोरचक्षुर्भिरीक्षन्ते प्राणिनो भुवि । हतास्ते यमदण्डेन सद्यो निरयगामिनः ।।
data.md: Those on earth, who cast dreadful looks on you, are immediately brought under the control of Yama and are constrained to go to hell.

data.v: गच्छ चारिष्टमव्यग्रः पन्थानमकुतोभयम् । प्रशाधि राज्यं धर्मेण गतिर्हि जगतो भवान् ।।
data.md: Kākutstha, do you now go with ease and fearlessly, and govern your kingdom righteously. O Rāma you are the refuge of the world.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु मुनिना प्राञ्जलिः प्रग्रहो नृपः । अभ्यवादयत प्राज्ञस्तमृषिं पुण्यशीलिनम् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the great and truthful Rşis the wise Rāma, with folded hands, saluted him and other Rșis, and with serene air ascended the golden car Puşpaka.

data.v: अभिवाद्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं तांश्च सर्वांस्तपोधनान् । अध्यारोहत्तदव्यग्रः पुष्पकं हेमभूषितम् ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of the great and truthful Rşis the wise Rāma, with folded hands, saluted him and other Rșis, and with serene air ascended the golden car Puşpaka.

data.v: तं प्रयान्तं मुनिगणा आशीर्वादैः समन्ततः । अपूजयन्महेन्द्राभं सहस्राक्षमिवामराः ।।
data.md: Like to the immortals welcoming the Chief of the deities the Rșis showered blessings upon Rāma from all sides while he was proceeding.

data.v: स्वस्थः स ददृशे रामः पुष्पके हेमभूषिते । शशी मेघसमीपस्थो यथा जलधरागमे ।।
data.md: And seated on golden car, he appeared like the moon, after the expiry of the rainy season.

data.v: ततोऽर्धदिवसे प्राप्ते पूज्यमानस्ततस्ततः । अयोध्यां प्राप्य काकुत्स्थो विमानादवरोहत ।।
data.md: Thereupon being welcomed by the villagers on his way he reached Ayodhyā at noon and descended at the middle apartment.

data.v: ततो विसृज्य रुचिरं पुष्पकं कामगामिनम् । कक्ष्यान्तरविनिक्षिप्तं द्वाःस्थं रामोऽब्रवीद्वचः ।।
लक्ष्मणं भरतं चैव गत्वा तौ लघुविक्रमौ । ममागमनमाख्याय शब्दापय च मा चिरम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon Rama said to the warder, Do you speedily go and having communicated my arrival to Lakşmaņa and Bharata bring them here.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भाषितं तस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । द्वाःस्थः कुमारावाहूय राघवाय न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.md: According to the command of Räma of unwearied actions, the warders went to the princes and communicated to them (the arrival).

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तु राघवः प्राप्तौ प्रियौ भरतलक्ष्मणौ । परिष्वज्य ततो रामो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Beholding Bharata and Lakşmaņa present, Rāma embraced them and said.

data.v: कृतं मया यथातथ्यं द्विजकार्यमनुत्तमम् । धर्मसेतुमतो भूयः कर्तुमिच्छामि राघवौ ।।
data.md: I have, as promised, performed the work of the excellent twice-born one. I wish now to perform a Rājasūya sacrifice, the source of religious glory, the destroyer of all sins, inexhaustible and un-ending.

data.v: युवाभ्यामात्मभूताभ्यां राजसूयमनुत्तमम् । सहितो यष्टुमिच्छामि तत्र धर्मो हि शाश्वतः ।।
data.md: Therefore, with you like my own self, I wish to engage in the most excellent and eternal Rājasūya sacrifice.

data.v: इष्ट्वा तु राजसूयेन मित्रः शत्रुनिबर्हणः । सुहुतेन सुयज्ञेन वरुणत्वमुपागमत् ।।
data.md: O slayer of foes, by celebrating Rājasūya, Mitra attained to the dignity of Varuņa.

data.v: सोमश्च राजसूयेन इष्ट्वा धर्मेण धर्मवित् । प्राप्तश्च सर्वलोकानां कीर्तिं स्थानं च शाश्वतम् ।।
data.md: And having celebrated the Soma sacrifice, conversant with piety, established eternal fame in the three worlds.

data.v: अस्मिन्नहनि यच्छ्रेयश्चिन्त्यतां तन्मया सह । हितं चायति युक्तं च प्रयतौ वक्तुमर्हथ ।।
data.md: Do you therefore consult with me even today as to what is proper. Do you consider carefully and tell me what is auspicious and productive of well-being in the long run.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु राघवस्यैतद्वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः । भरतः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of Raghava, Bharata, wellskilled in the are of speech, with folded hands, said O pious Sir, in you are established piety, earth and fame.

data.v: त्वयि धर्मः परः साधो त्वयि सर्वा वसुंधरा । प्रतिष्ठिता महाबाहो यशश्चामितविक्रम ।।
data.md: Hearing the words of Raghava, Bharata, wellskilled in the are of speech, with folded hands, said O pious Sir, in you are established piety, earth and fame.

data.v: महीपालाश्च सर्वे त्वां प्रजापतिमिवामराः । निरीक्षन्ते महात्मानो लोकनाथं यथा वयम् ।।
प्रजाश्च पितृवद्राजन्पश्यन्ति त्वां महाबल । पृथिव्यां गतिभूतोऽसि प्राणिनामपि राघव ।।
स त्वमेवंविधं यज्ञमाहर्तासि कथं नृप । पृथिव्यां राजवंशानां विनाशो यत्र दृश्यते ।।
पृथिव्यां ये च पुरुषा राजन्पौरुषमागताः । सर्वेषां भविता तत्र क्षयः सर्वान्तकोपमः ।।
data.md: O king! all those men, who are proud of manliness, being incensed with great ire on the occasion of this sacrifice, shall bring ruin upon all.

data.v: स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल गुणैरतुलविक्रम । पृथिवीं नार्हसे हन्तुं वशे हि तव वर्तते ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, the whole earth has been brought under your subjection so it is not proper to devastate it.

data.v: भरतस्य तु तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वामृतमयं यथा । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे रामः सत्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.md: Hearing the sweet words of the celestial saint Nārada, Rāma was greatly delighted and addressing Lakşmaņa said.

data.v: उवाच च शुभां वाणीं कैकेय्या नन्दिवर्धनम् । प्रीतोऽस्मि परितुष्टोऽस्मि तवाद्य वचनेन हि ।।
data.md: Hearing those sweet accents of Bharata, Rāma, having truth for his prowess, attained to incomparable delight, and addressed the enhancer of Kaikeyi's delight with kind words, saying: O you freed from sins, I have been greatly delighted with you.

data.v: इदं वचनमक्लीबं त्वया धर्मसमाहितम् । व्याहृतं पुरुषव्याघ्र पृथिव्याः परिपालनम् ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, for the preservation of earth, you have given vent to words, without any hesitation, pregnant with manliness and piety.

data.v: एष तस्मादभिप्रायाद्राजसूयात्क्रतूत्तमात् । निवर्तयामि धर्मज्ञ तव सुव्याहृतेन वै ।।
data.md: O you conversant with piety, according to your wise counsels, I refrain from celebrating this Rājasūya sacrifice.

data.v: प्रजानां पालनं धर्मो राज्ञां यज्ञेन संमितः । तस्माच्छृणोमि ते वाक्यं साधूक्तं सुसमाहितम् ।।
तथोक्तवति रामे तु भरते च महात्मनि । लक्ष्मणोऽपि शुभं वाक्यमुवाच रघुनन्दनम् ।।
data.md: After the conversation between Råma and Bharata had been over, Laksmana, with reasonable words, said to the former.

data.v: अश्वमेधो महायज्ञः पावनः सर्वपाप्मनाम् । पावनस्तव दुर्धर्षो रोचतां क्रतुपुंगवः ।।
data.md: O Rāma, among sacrifices Aśvamedha is the best and the remover of all sins; it is my prayer therefore that your desire might be turned towards this great and highly purifying sacrifice.

data.v: श्रूयते हि पुरावृत्तं वासवे सुमहात्मनि । ब्रह्महत्यावृतः शक्रो हयमेधेन पावितः ।।
data.md: It is said in this Purānas, that Purandara, sullied by the sin consequent upon slaying a Brāhmaṇa, was again purified by celebrating a horse sacrifice.

data.v: पुरा किल महाबाहो देवासुरसमागमे । वृत्रो नाम महानासीद्दैतेयो लोकसंमतः ।।
data.md: O you having long arms, formerly, during the war between gods and demons there flourished a highly honoured Asura under the name of Vſtra.

data.v: विस्तीर्णा योजनशतमुच्छ्रितस्त्रिगुणं ततः । अनुरागेण लोकांस्त्रीन्स्नेहात्पश्यति सर्वतः ।।
data.md: The breadth of his body was a hundred Yojanas and the height there of was three hundred Yojanas. Considering all under his subjection he used to regard them with affection.

data.v: धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च बुद्ध्या च परिनिष्ठितः । शशास पृथिवीं सर्वां धर्मेण सुसमाहितः ।।
data.md: He was pious, grateful and used to perform nothing without proper deliberation. And treading tracks he used to govern his subjects very carefully.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रशासति तदा सर्वकामदुघा मही । रसवन्ति प्रसूतानि मूलानि च फलानि च ।।
data.md: During his administration earth produced all wished-for objects; roots and fruits were tasteful and flowers were fragrant.

data.v: अकृष्टपच्या पृथिवी सुसंपन्ना महात्मनः । स राज्यं तादृशं भुङ्क्ते स्फीतमद्भुतदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: Without being cultivated earth used to yield crops. In this wise for many long years he governed a prosperous and wonderful kingdom.

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिः समुत्पन्ना तपः कुर्यामनुत्तमम् । तपो हि परमं श्रेयस्तपो हि परमं सुखम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon he determined upon performing a hard penance. He considered asceticism as the best of all and regarded all other things as mere illusions.

data.v: स निक्षिप्य सुतं ज्येष्ठं पौरेषु परमेश्वरम् । तप उग्रमुपातिष्ठत्तापयन्सर्वदेवताः ।।
data.md: Having resolved thus and placed his son Madhureśvara on the throne Vſtra engaged in austerities creating terror to all deities.

data.v: तपस्तप्यति वृत्रे तु वासवः परमार्तवत् । विष्णुं समुपसंक्रम्य वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.md: He being thus engaged in asceticism, Indra, greatly terrified, approached Vişņu and said.

data.v: तपस्यता महाबाहो लोका वृत्रेण निर्जिताः । बलवान्स हि धर्मात्मा नैनं शक्ष्यामि बाधितुम् ।।
data.md: O you having long arms, by virtue of his asceticism Vſtra is about to conquer all the worlds. He is pious, so I cannot subdue him.

data.v: यद्यसौ तप आतिष्ठेद्भूय एव सुरेश्वर । यावल्लोका धरिष्यन्ति तावदस्य वशानुगाः ।।
data.md: O illustrious Sir, if his ascetic powers grow more we shall be constrained to live under his control for ever from the creation.

data.v: त्वं चैनं परमोदारमुपेक्षसि महाबल । क्षणं हि न भवेद्वृत्रः क्रुद्धे त्वयि सुरेश्वर ।।
data.md: Do you therefore not neglect any longer this highly Generous Asura. They self being enraged, O lord of deities, Vſtra shall not live even for a moment.

data.v: यदा हि प्रीतिसंयोगं त्वया विष्णो समागतः । तदा प्रभृति लोकानां नाथत्वमुपलब्धवान् ।।
data.md: O Vişnu, from the time he succeeded in propitiating you, he has obtained the sovereignty of the three worlds.

data.v: स त्वं प्रसादं लोकानां कुरुष्व सुमहायशः । त्वत्कृतेन हि सर्वं स्यात्प्रशान्तमजरं जगत् ।।
data.md: Do you, therefore, be propitiated now; save you none can free this world from thorns and bring it at rest.

data.md: O Vişnu, all the deities are waiting for you; do you help them by slaying Vộtra. O you having a large mind, you are always the help of these high-souled deities. It is impossible for any one else to accomplish the present work. You are the refuge of the helpless.

data.md: Again I am to afford excellent felicity to you. I shall say the solution by which Indra will able to slay him.
